review.title: the room smells
review.reviewText: I did not expect that  room for that price. no elevator

review.title: Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: The staff and room were perfect. Very kind people, very clean room

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Despite the two star rating, we found it clean, comfortable and well situated to the Fort Mason event we attended and to the Union St, and Fisherman's Warf area.  A real find for tourists on a budget.  Free parking a plus,  I'd give it 3 stars.

review.title: Horrible, RUDE STAFF *HOUSECLEANING*
review.reviewText:
This place is NOT for disabled people, so then stay away, it is HORRIBLE, and the house cleaning staff is RUDE, the bathrooms are a mess and SHORT to the ground, the bathroom Floor is a accident happening, slippery with/without socks on, this place needs a serious look at from Management, I will be writing to AARP and The CORPORation that deals with this place.
DO NOT waste your time or your hard earned money to stay here, this was my first time to this HOTEL and I will NOT be coming back to this place, RUDE and messy and NOT friendly..  If you are reading this, do not waste your time with this place unless you just want a bad Experience.
review.positiveRemarks: I thought that it was going to be closer by the wharf, but then it was NOT.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs to be better for people with Disabilities..  especially Bathroom area!!!
review.locationRemarks: would have liked to be closer to things other then spending more money on taxi's to get to places that I knew or wanted to go.

review.reviewText: no extra beds available, phone didn't work, only give one very thin extra blanket and it's dirty.
review.negativeRemarks: offer extra beds
review.locationRemarks: eating, close landmark.

review.title: Minimum amenities
review.reviewText: Just the basics. They offer a simple room with a noisy ice machine down the hall. The bathroom is cramped with  cardboard fresh towels.  The beds appeared clean and the turndown service was pontual.  Breakfast was served in the front closet sized office. Again,  just the basics.  If you want to remember your youth hostelling days across Europe then I suggest this place for a trip down memory lane.

review.title: Cheap stay
review.reviewText: Last minute resort, paid way too much for poor facility
review.negativeRemarks: They could upgrade the bed, have clean shower curtains, and taken out the old arm chair that clearly didn't belong in the room

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for the positive feedback and we are so happy that you enjoyed our location and were able to enjoy the marina.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very helpful and nice. I love the Marina area very close to great restaurants and walking distance to marina green.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is very good and the hotel staff is excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking is sometimes difficult
review.locationRemarks: Great location the marina is a great area

managementResponses.response: We rent out rooms out constantly and we do understand that everyone has a level of comfort, we are more than happy to change rooms to make you more comfortable, we are an older hotel, but we keep it clean and we can change the linens and replace the towels, however we are sorry if you were not treated respectfully and with you the best of luck in your travels. Thanks again for the feedback.

review.title: Nightmare in San Fransisco and Shocking Expedia
review.reviewText: The women hotel manager was one of the rudest people I have ever had dealings with . The hotel room was really dirty, including thick mould on the shower curtain, stains on the furniture, towels with black all over them, bathroom dirty and ripped bed linen.However, the way my complaint was dealt with by EXPEDIA was disgusting and they were most uncaring and unprofessional.
review.positiveRemarks: Other male members of staff tried to be helpful. They were international students and understood.
review.negativeRemarks: You would need to change women owner/manager. Standard of cleaning.
review.locationRemarks: San fransisco is beautiful.

managementResponses.response: Thank you, we appreciate your feedback.

review.reviewText:
Glad I did not pay attention to the terrible reviews... They only have 14 parking spaces...
It was a normal stay.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for the feedback, we are in the midst of some renovations, however we understand that we are a limited service budget hotel and due to the fact that we rent our room night after night, the linens can be worn, we are always happy to replace them for you. Our rooms are clean and maintained for nightly use, we are sorry that you were uncomfortable and wish you the best finding a hotel more suitable to your needs.

review.title: Awful
review.reviewText: This hotel is as run down as they come. Clearly the owner just doesn't care. The room smelled, the shower curtain has what looked like blood stains all over it. The walls were paper thin - could hear everything and I mean everything. Anyone could walk up the stairs and hang out outside your door - door opens to outside like a motel. No sense of security. I'm no princess by any means and don't expect super quality - hence booking here. But it was even awful for someone who is low maintenance. I was scared to sleep under the sheets! Do not stay here. Spend extra and stay somewhere where you don't have to worry about randoms outside your door and can sleep comfortably knowing you have clean sheets.  this place was like wing in a horror movie ! Just terrible!

review.title: Cheap, but near the bay
review.reviewText: Generally clean room but very noisy area.  Basic accommodations with no extras except free parking.  Not bad if you're just looking for a bed.

managementResponses.response: We appreciate your business and we do keep a clean hotel so if you get a room that is less than desirable, please as to be relocated or we can replace the towels and linens as we want to you to be happy and comfortable.

review.title: Hotel next to bus and marina district
review.reviewText:
Area of the hotel not a lot of restaurants and bars. We can heard the Road from the room. 
Parking free and breakfast too, so nice. 
Room not really clean: sofa really dirty and some hairs in our bed. 
Bus less than 5 min by walk. 
Hotel next to the center and the attraction. 
Good value for the price.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much, we understand that this is an older review, but we just wanted to say thanks again for your business and kind words.

review.reviewText: The place was nice and located really close to where I needed to be. I didn't need anything special so, it was perfect for me.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the tub

managementResponses.response: We understand that everyone has a level of comfort and we are sorry that you were not comfortable and we wish you the best finding a hotel that is more suitable for you.

review.title: Bad hotel with lots of noise, no elevator.

review.title: good location, shabby rooms
review.reviewText: The ice machine is right outside the room I took, very noisy. The airconditionor is too old and also makes a lot of noise

review.title: Avoid
review.reviewText: Very dirty insecure hotel. The rooms are accessible by a staircase to the street. Rooms have bed bugs. I found a pair of dirty panties behind the couch. Stains all over the couch, chair, and bed sheets. Breakfast was bare bare minimum, worse of all the room is not even that cheap.

managementResponses.response: We appreciate the feedback and wish you the best of luck finding a hotel more suitable to your needs.

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText: We stayed 4 nights and never received replacement soap, shampoo or coffee. Extreme noise from the suitcases rolling outside our room. Uncomfortable bed and stained/dirty chair. Breakfast was not a continental breakfast. No fruit only cold cereal and breads.  Spend an extra $50 and stay somewhere you can get a decent nights sleep.

managementResponses.response: We appreciate the feedback and we are 8 min. walking distance to the Marina district and 3 min driving.  You are correct we are a bit further from pier 39, bus is about 25 min and walking is 30 min.  We are sorry if you were disappointed as some of our rooms have micro and fridge but not all.

review.title: Not as advertised.
review.reviewText: Small dark room in a bad inconvenient location. Parking was first come first serve. 12 spaces for 40 plus rooms. Not any where close to the bay front and wharf. No refrigerator and no microwave.

review.title: Hotel close to bus route
review.reviewText: So many stairs to carry your luggage up. Not the best neighborhood.

managementResponses.response: We understand that this reviews is older, but we wanted to say thank you for the feedback and we are happy that you enjoyed your stay and were able to explore S.F.!

review.reviewText: The neighborhood is a perfect location to explore SF from. The room was super clean and the staff where very nice. Perfect budget accommodation for San Francisco.

review.title: Inn with parking
review.reviewText:
We choose Howard Johnson because it had parking, true it's first come first serve, but there was never a problem.
It's not glamorous, but certainly met our needs for this trip.
The best thing about this place was the bed. This king bed was the most comfortable bed my husband and I have ever slept on, we didn't want to wake up in the morning, so we didn't get up until 10:30 everyday.
There are many restaurants within a block or two. We found a Spanish restaurant serving tapa's that was delicious and rated high on Zagat and a Thai restaurant we liked.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy to get to and a very comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Newer towels and better fitting sheets. The toaster did not even turn the bread to light brown, they should go to a  restaurant supply store.
review.locationRemarks: In San Francisco, you can get anywhere easily with a GPS or Uber.

review.title: Great bed, but....
review.reviewText:
My expectations for this hotel were not super high, so I was pleasantly surprised that it was NOT a dump.  The building, hotel room and dÃ©cor are dated, but I found the room neat, orderly, and clean.  The bed was great--perfect combination of softness and firmness.  And the sheets were over-the-top soft.  My two nights of sleep were exceptionally pleasant there.  

The two disappointments were the staff and bathroom linen.  
STAFF:The gentleman that checked me in was nice enough.  It was a late night check in and he processed me very quickly and I was off to my room.  However, the woman at the front desk the next morning appeared to be uninterested in anything going on with the guests.  She appeared to be surfing the web--her eyes were glued to the computer screen, short of when you said something to distract her.  Although she was not mean or curt, she just seemed distracted.  

LINEN:  I'm not picky on the type of linen I get.  I understand how it goes--linen is costly and hotels can only afford so much.  However, my whole stock of wash clothes were like old rags you save to was your care.  All was worn out--just seemed old.  The part that really disappointed was that one of the rags looked so stained, that it really should have been thrown away.  The rest weren't that much better.  My advice to HoJo--invest in new linen.

Otherwise everything was OK.
review.positiveRemarks: Location!  Near great areas. Very walkable.
review.negativeRemarks: See above--LINEN
review.locationRemarks:
Great breakfast place--GoLo cafe
Chestnut St stores, restaurants,

review.title: No elevator. Free parking if you get there early.
review.reviewText: 2 miles from the wharf. The hotel information said close. Didn't tell us there wasn't an elevator for our luggage. Very poor continental breakfast

review.title: Average
review.reviewText: No elevator and no parking..... only thing we did not like about our stay in this hotel.  Very clean.. great staff..
review.negativeRemarks: Parking and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who is handicapped. They have no handicapped facilities.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf But So-So Quality
review.reviewText: All the rooms face one another across a stair well, both first and second floors.  No elevators!! The rooms are small and the free breakfast is packaged pastries. The main attraction is its proximity to the Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Larger rooms; the bathroom was nice. Bad pillows.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermen's Wharf, local restaurants, crooked street, Palace of Fine Arts

review.reviewText: Mouldy sheets and curtains, dirty carpet, guy smoking pot on stairs near our room. Most staff friendly. Good bike rental across the road.

review.title: Free parking, great location, clean comfortable ro
review.reviewText: Stayed at this Howard Johnsons. Booked through Expedia who led me to believe with a rollaway I could fit 5 in the room. There were no rollaways and had to book another room.  The staff was so nice and tried to accommodate me as best they could. The hotel does not have street appeal, however once you are in the room you are ok.  Rooms are clean, nicely decorated and comfortable. Location is great,  parking free and continental breakfast included for reasonable rates. So if you can get past the pink paint on the outside, you will be happy you are there.
review.negativeRemarks: curb appeal
review.locationRemarks: Near Fisherman Wharf, Piers, Coit Tower etc.

review.title: Location is great
review.reviewText: Location of hotel was great.  .46 miles to marathon expo, also near firsherman's whart and other waterfront sites. Parking is free, but a hassle as it is very limited and open to first come. Walked a lot so we would not have car without a garage at night.  Beds marginal. only full size and crowded for two, comfort level 2 or 2.5.  breakfast verylimited  in scope. no fruit. only english muffin, cerial, cheap pasteries coffee and orange juice.  staff is very good and friendly
review.positiveRemarks: Location and free parking when available.
review.negativeRemarks: better parking, better breakfast and queen size beds
review.locationRemarks: close to waterfront

review.title: Great location in the heart of San Francisco!
review.reviewText: My siblings and I all came together from different parts of the country to spend a long weekend in San Francisco. This hotel was in a great central location to tourist sites and public transportation, but was also within walking distance if you would rather a nice 15-20 min walk. The beds were very comfortable. The room was clean and furnished nicely. The outside of the hotel is not as nice as the inside. The free parking and breakfast was nice. The rate was good, all things considered. San Francisco is not a cheap city to visit! But we had a great time.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The free parking and free breakfast were nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The outside of the building is a little shabby.
review.locationRemarks: It's not far from Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardelli Square.

review.title: Poorly kept and unclean; decent location.
review.reviewText: The first room we stayed in had a bedspread with holes in in, possibly cigarette burns, and black powdwer (mascara?) on the pillow.  When we moved to another room it was better, but I found a condom wrapper in the bedside table.  I won't again be soaking up the ambiance at a Hojo any time soon.

review.title: Great location, run down hotel, subpar breakfast.
review.reviewText: The hotel is situated in the heart of the marina Bay Area. The location is what makes this hotel attractive. However the hotel is definitely way past due for renovation and make over. The breakfast is only in the name - barely any food and whatever is put out there is hardly worth eating. If you are willing to sacrifice luxury and don't mind stepping out for breakfast then you are staying in the heart of SF.

review.title: I would not stay at this hotel again.
review.reviewText: Our bathroom did not work during our entire stay. Reported it on day one to management and was not repaired. We were moved to another room on the last day of our stay, but how inconvenient is that? I requested a refund and because it was booked through Expedia and paid for, they would not oblige. I will never stay in this hotel again, nor will I book a trip through Expedia for their lack of response.

review.title: Decent stay
review.reviewText: All was Ok in went smoothly. Hotel is quite well located, staff friendly enough, garage available if you are early enough, something to eat for breakfast. Overall we were satisfied with our stay in this SF hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Walking to Marina and towards Golden Gate Bridge, laso to Fisherman's Warf via famous Lombard Street turns.

review.title: San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: I don't recall anything on the website that warns those with breathing issues or other disabilities that there is no elevator. The first floor rooms are up a long stairway and we we placed on the second floor. The small print warned that there was free parking as available. It wasn't available. We were offered free non-existent street parking, but found a $25 a day parking structure a block and 1/2 away that was not mentioned to us. The staff was polite and friendly. The room propertt were clean.

review.title: Pricey hotel
review.reviewText: Was told free parking, but very limited parking in cramped spaces with other cars blocking people in. Free breakfast  was cereal and pretty packaged buns. no elevator and the 1st floor was up a flight of stairs. Room smelled like clorox. Avoid if possible.
this hotel needs all new linen , the linen very old and stained.

review.title: Reasonable hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful to help me get around without a car.  The location was great!
Pls state that there is NO lift as carrying our heavy luggage up and down the stairs is not a trivial matter!

review.title: Would definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: Room was cute and clean. Hotel was charming, especially for the price. Lots if places to eat walking distance. It was a neat place to use as a hub for walking around San Francisco. I would definitely recommend it and stay again.
The parking was very limited and the spaces very small.  I felt it was a little over priced. Room service was very accommodating.  It is a walk up with no elevator.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great.  One block over is a trendy shopping/eating area.  Easy access to many sight seeing destinations.

review.title: Customer service was terrible
review.reviewText: I would not book a room on this hotel at this specific location, the receptionist gave me a hard time

Parking was disappointing.  Website indicates that parking available. However upon arrival the staff indicate that parking is available on the basis of first in first served. . Given that no other parking is available in that part of the city this is enormously inconvenient. The only reason I chose that hotel was the availability of parking

review.title: Budget hotel left us disappointed
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel for a quick, budget, trip with our kids to visit San Francisco.  We didn't have much time to make our reservations and were trying to stay within a budget.  We chose this one, thinking that the Howard Johnson name would provide a degree of consistency with our expectations.  Once we arrived, however, we saw several other similar hotels on the same street which looked to be better maintained.  We did enjoy the free parking and proximity to bus lines.  We never felt unsafe.  A few things we did not enjoy:  The hotel room door doesn't open all the way because it hits the bed.  We had to plunge our own toilet twice.  The ice machine was located just outside our room, and all 4 nights people were using it between 2 am and 4 am.   Someone vomited in an empty planter overnight and it remained there for days.  The free breakfast was in such a tiny location that we did not even attempt it.  We did see people coming out with prepackaged danish pastries (think 7-11).   The people at the front desk seemed pretty helpful, but it seems as though the facility as a whole is not well maintained.
review.positiveRemarks: Free parking, proximity to bus line.
review.negativeRemarks: Building is in need of maintenance.

review.title: False, lied about parking
review.reviewText: Bad, parking not available they entire stay. Can not accommodate cars spaces to  the rooms available. The breakfast was horrible, cold cereal and toast, bad coffee. It tasted like instant coffee. They did not come into clean my room, or bring fresh towels. Requested for additional towels. No towels were available. They claim to have run out. No intenion to stay there again. The staff ther looked unhappy and not very aware of how to help.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the bay and free street parking, which was 4 blocks away.
review.negativeRemarks: Change the wording to limited parking. False advertisement. Get more towels
review.locationRemarks: Public parks and public transportation

review.title: Needed maid service.
review.reviewText: My room had a general dirty feel.  Towels were rough and had stains.  Even white blanket in bed had a blood stain.  Chair was dirty.  Dirt between carpet and tile.   The commons area was dirty.  Two buckets and mop was under stairs all three days.  It needed lots of elbow grease.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness.

review.title: Need to invest in new towels
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is prime, it is centralized to several iconic location within San Francisco. However, the hotel needs to invest in new towels.
Nothing fancy, but it was what we needed. Convenient to the wharf, Golden Gate Park, etc.

review.title: Terrible experience!
review.reviewText: The staff was rude an not at all accommodating. They said they had no parking when I got there because they were "very busy" that weekend. I also came home with bites all over my body. I think it may have been bed bugs. A week later I'm still itching all over and miserable. Do not stay here!

review.title: Great location, decent place
review.reviewText: Lots of places to eat, budget friendly, kid approved. Safe neighborhood fun to walk around at night with teenagers. Hotel was clean though dated, staff was very friendly and helpful. Easy access to buses or a nice walk to Fisherman's Warf.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the room's linens and bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of good family places to eat. Lots of night life. Close to a park. Easy access to Pier 39.

review.reviewText: There are only a couple of parking spots so I had to transfer all of my luggage from several blocks away. Also, the walls were very thin so every time an air conditioner or heater turned on or off, it felt like the room was shaking

review.title: Dingy sheets and stained towels bothered me.
review.reviewText: The hotel room was not looking clean due to stained linen and upholstery. Location was good though. Also, no elevators for those parents traveling with small children and big loads. Parking was easy.

review.title: no available parking space for your car.
review.reviewText: I won"t be back on that hotel.  Try to find another hotel nearby that you are safe with the same price.
review.negativeRemarks: parking space ..
review.locationRemarks: location is fine but i will rather find another hotel with the same price that i am secure and safe.

review.title: good location but dirty
review.reviewText: Sheets were not changed,towels are old, beddings were stained and old...

review.title: Motel  on Lombard Street
review.reviewText: The inner concrete courtyard is about 12 feet wide and serves as a wonderful echo chamber.   Almost any voice can be heard.   At 3AM there was an argument with screaming that woke me up.    There is no way to avoid hearing these sounds.  People are in the courtyard at all hours.

review.title: NO PARKING.....
review.reviewText: If u park behind the hotel it looks like ur var will be jacked... no street lights...

review.title: Nice hotel convenient location to some shopping
review.reviewText: No fridge in room, not good for long stays, hotel staff not too informative
PARKING SPACE IS INCONVENIENT. IT WAS NOT QIUET DURING SLEEPING HOURS. THE HOTEL RECEPTIONISTS WERE NOT FRIENDLY AND CORTEOUS.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking space should be available to the guest.
review.locationRemarks: Golden Gate Bridge and Ghirardelli Square

review.title: Basic + Clean
review.reviewText: Stayed here overnight. Basic, clean and convenient. Plus free breakfast. Good deal for the price.

review.title: Convenience was the key
review.reviewText: Allthough it was a great price and convenient, there was a broken picture in the room with glass shards sticking out. I called the office but they did not care, The noise was crazy about 5am when the people who live in the hotel were waking up and made sure everyone was woke up. Other than that like I said it was the convenience that motivated our stay.

review.title: Ho Jo...not so good Mojo!
review.reviewText: Horrible parking space. Poor and unsanitary way to serve the breakfast.  Noisy and not very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything...
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union and Chestnut shopping districts and the Marina.

review.title: The Smoking Hotel.
review.reviewText: the rooms smells terrible. the sheets and towels was dirty.

review.title: Close to tourist attractions - very small rooms.
review.reviewText: Small rooms, minimal breakfast,  moldy shower curtain.  You get what you pay for though so I can't complain alot! We just needed a place to stay the night and it fit those purposes!  Great restaurants very nearby and near to tourist attractions.

review.title: Not what we expected!
review.reviewText: Very disappointed! The facility was dirty and the TV and internet did not work.  We didn't receive adequate towels and parking was not available although it was advertised.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything!
review.locationRemarks: Not the safe neighborhood we expected so we didn't stay in the immediate area.

review.title: Needs improvements
review.reviewText: Hotel is out dated and rooms had a bad smell when we walked in

review.title: Noisy, only surface clean, dirty underneath
review.reviewText: Initial impressions, was the smell when I walked into the room, there was a musty smell. Then when I turned around to lock the door behind me, I looked down and noticed a ~.5" gap between the floor and the bottom of the door. Then I checked out the bathroom, looked in the tub, and there was set in stains inside the tub, and a not brilliant white floor towel folded nicely on the edge of the tub. The toilet, under the rim was black all around the bowl under the rim. On the surface, the room was mostly clean, but when closer inspection, it was significantly lacking.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning. Noise pollution.

review.title: Nice hotel close to very good spots
review.reviewText: The hotel is comfy, near to very good restaurants and bus stops to go to all touristic spots of San Francisco. Within 30min, you are in Embarcadero, within 40min you are in the Golden Gate etc. Staff is easily approachable and make everything they can to make your stay welcoming and easy.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice staff, room has an iron, and localization.
review.locationRemarks: Everything in San Francisco is easily . Just an example: 5-10min away from the hotel, you'll find Ghirardelli`s Square.

review.reviewText: Not enough parking, didn't give info in advance. Not clean.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was very old, quite difficult to climb steps two floors to room. Had room changed so we only had to climb one floor. The place was covered with trash and cigarette buts the first night.
review.positiveRemarks: Office staff was accommodating as much as possible.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Close to shops and bars.

review.title: bed bug infested nightmare
review.reviewText: Worst hotel experience ever . My wife is covered in bed bug bites (40+) . Hotel offered $25 refund on a Three night bill . Eventually refunded $50 and gave us the room next door . Hotel seemed indifferent to our situation ( as in they seemed used to people being bit by bed bugs ). Would not stay  here again on a bet . Breakfast area cramped , dirty with limited variety and oppressive heat (85 F +). Rooms are dark and dated looking . Surprised Expedia allows such a low level of service on its site .
review.positiveRemarks: the fact that we were leaving after 3 days
review.negativeRemarks: Getting rid of the bed bugs would be a start .Improve service. clean up breakfast area reduce heat and give some variety of food
review.locationRemarks: close to bus routes and a few restaurants

review.title: OK for price in San Fran
review.reviewText: Good location within walking distance of transport or walk o Waterfront.  Only drawback for me was lack of a lift to second floor.  Critical for me at age 76

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Rooms had been recently remodeled and were very clean and attractive.  This is not a luxury hotel so don't have that expectation and you'll be very pleased considering the low price.  There's good restaurants and shops a block or two away on Chestnut Street.  Convenient bus service.  Desk clerks were friendly and helpful.  Our room was upstairs and there are no elevators so take that in consideration if you have physical problems.

review.title: less expensive
review.reviewText: older hotel no elevator and was on the second floor, very nice that they had some free parking
review.positiveRemarks: price and for its age in good shape
review.locationRemarks: near fishermans wharf but a long way to walk there

review.title: Good Location!
review.reviewText: We arrived at hotel and was greeted cheerfully and allowed to store our luggage as check in - is not until 3 pm. We finally checked in and lugged our luggage two flights of stairs (so be prepared to pack lightly).  Walked into room, then our really experience started - problems with TV, problems with back up of toilet and finally unable to phone out of the hotel. Each time something happened the staff was pleasant and attend to the issue.  We finally felt very unsettled in the room, expecting something else to happen so asked to be moved to another room , which was clean and everything worked except for the phone system.  The staff at the hotel were also very cheerful and helpful! Very poor for a Howard Johnston Hotel! - but saying that the  hotel was good location and overall meet are needs for the time we were in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great, 20 minutes to the Pier and also very close to the bus stop.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms could be updated as they are in a poor state.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the waterfront park and pier. Safe area// convenient store close by. Ladies close to a place to have a pedicure/manicure!

review.title: Good value, OK location.
review.reviewText: Originally gave us a smoking room, instead of the non-smoking room, but corrected it after we complained. No microwave or refrigerator, but we managed. Beds were comfortable.

review.title: Parking problem
review.reviewText:
Hotel location is correct, room was cleaned but the big issue is parking the car. No place available for all clients and no easy to find a parking around the hotel even paying parking. Correct price.
In case you are traveling by plane, no problem.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking.
review.locationRemarks: Location is correct compared to others hotel located at Lombard Street.

review.title: On a very busy & noisy street US101South
review.reviewText: The hotel was on Lombard street but @ the Golden Gate Bridge end not the crooked street end. It didn't have an elevator so my husband had to struggle up 2 flights of stairs with 4 heavy bags( no help offered)! The room didn't have a welcome book & no fire orders. When I asked @ reception they said it had only been taken over by Howard Johnson in recent weeks however I thought that was a poor excuse as the previous owner should have had them in all rooms. There was no kettle, no fridge, no safe available so we had to carry all our valuables everywhere we went. The sink had no plug in it. The TV had 2 remotes with no instructions. I had to ask receptionist how to use the TV, there was no list of TV programmes & we never found the weather channel which was the only channel we were interested in. The hotel was very noisy @ night with people coming & going all night & doors slamming. We opened our door one morning to find trash left outside the door( not ours). The air conditioning was very noisy. All the doors slammed. The breakfast was very basic & held in the small reception area, not exactly comfortable to start your day with traffic zooming by outside.we felt like we were in a gold fish bowl. There was no pool.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing, the only luxury was a nice machine @ the end of the corridor.
review.negativeRemarks: Fridge in room, health & Safety notice, plug in sink, safe, quieter air conditioning & better noise insulation & an elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Marina for good views of Golden Gate Bridge. Walk to Cow Hollow shops on Union Street.

review.reviewText: this hotel is close to many attractions, the room was clean but the blankets has holes in it. the staff was friendly, the coffee was good and the pastries were okay. I only stay one night and could not stay the second night because the noisy at night was unbearable .it sound like a train coming into a tunnel and this was all night long, every time a big truck drove by .

the location was good near the  bus stop to go to the Golden Gate and walking distance from the fisherman wharf

the location is good but some strange people walking around at night., but the bus stop to go to the Golden Gate is 
right outside the Hotel and all

review.title: OK hotel near bus routes
review.reviewText: Although there is free parking they don't tell you it's 1st come 1st served and if it's full (about 12 cars) you have to find a place on the street and that's not easy. Breakfast is nothing to write home about but good places (IHOP, diner) are within walking distance. Room is basic but you don't spend much time there anyway. You need an engineering degree to watch TV and they had to come to the room twice to reset the breaker. When we left we were scared by a homeless guy living in front of our car who suddenly appeared as w got in the car.

review.title: Bad Location.
review.reviewText: Bad Location.  To far from the Fisherman Wharf.  About 20 Blocks.  It was suppose to be located at the Fisherman Wharf.  This is a Motel converted into a Hotel.  Does not have enough Parking space.
review.negativeRemarks: Do not offer it as located at the Fishermen Wharf
review.locationRemarks: Bad Location.

review.title: not a very nice motel no parking

review.reviewText: One of the cheaper hotels in the San Francisco downtown area but I still think its still overpriced. but then again everything in Frisco is. Friendly hotel staff. Facilities seem a little older but maintenance was fair.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to San Francisco sites and right at Lombard St.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, elevator

review.title: Too much for too little
review.reviewText: This hotel was way too much money for what you get. We needed a hotel that was easy to take public transportation. We got that. As for the hotel itself, very disappointing. Very old. Towels were horrible. Very little parking. I definately didn't get what I paid for! Don't think I would stay here again.

review.title: Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: It was an ok experience, the hotel was used for what we needed. There was nothing nice about it.  The toilets wouldn't even flush a normal size poop.

review.title: Experience
review.reviewText: Seemed a bit expensive for what we got. It was an average room nothing to brag about.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was ok and parking was free. The parking was limited, but walked everywhere or took public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: A few cosmetic updates would be good-sheets were ripped and the electrical outlet looked like there had been a fire.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to the Crooked Street.

review.title: Horrible Howard Johnstone
review.reviewText: Terrible, shabby room next to the ice making machine. Torn bedding chipped and dilapidated furniture. Breakfast facilities amounted to 2 tables with 4 chairs each for capacity booked hotel.Pre packaged food such as bagels and pastries. Some loose sliced bread to toast in a toaster that had well passed its use by date and a few pieces of fruit insufficient even for Christ to do anything with.
review.negativeRemarks: Dining facilities, Food quality, internet, furniture bedding, change management and attitude toward guests.
review.locationRemarks: san francisco is a wonderful place with lots of things to see and do. There are good hotels in Lombard street adjacent to this one at similar prices.

review.title: Good location!!!!
review.reviewText: The room was loud, could hear the traffic, people talking, someone in the next room drying their hair. Most of the staff were nice. Great location!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Comfortable - not too flashy - clean - everything went well
review.negativeRemarks: all good
review.locationRemarks: near conference.

review.title: Room, parking, and breakfast
review.reviewText: They do have a parking garage with only 12 to 16 spaces.  first come first serve.  Room beds were hard.  Sink had mold on it.  Dirt stains on walls.  Breakfast was nothing as picture suggested.  Choices are plain oatmeal, bananas, Bear claws, prepackaged danishes, O.J. and Apple Juice.   Door handle very loose.  For the price in a safe neighborhood what do you expect!  Would give plenty of info with recommendation
review.positiveRemarks: proximity to pier 39 and Golden Gate Bridge
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast goes a long way to happiness.  General housekeeping of rooms
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, took the a tour bus around town and it was great.  Drove up to Muir Woods.  A must see!

review.reviewText: Although staff was friendly, hotel is really run down. Mold in restroom and filthy baseboards. There were never enough towels for the 4 of us. The towels were so thin and ragged. On a positive note, location was perfect for shopping and dining.

review.title: The rooms are small, smoke smell & a lot of noise.
review.reviewText: The location is good, but the rooms are very small and not very clean.  Not enough parking for all the rooms. Even though they advertise a non-smoking policy. Guest are smoking right outside of the rooms in a common area and the cigarette smoke comes in the room.  In addition, guests like to visit in the common area so it is very noisy. No windows looking outside only to the covered common area. This hotel was our worst experience, had to cancel the rest of the reservation. Do not recommend!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, but there many other nicer hotels in the area.

review.reviewText: If you don't mind walking a few miles, you'll find that this hotel is walking distance from several local attractions, including Fisherman's Wharf. We also walked to the Golden Gate Bridge and Chinatown from the hotel, but that's probably farther than most people would want to walk on these very steep local streets. Bring a sweatshirt and sunscreen. The wind is chilly but the sun is strong.

review.title: Absolute nasty hotel. It stinks like Urine
review.reviewText:
This hotel is disgusting and not even cheap.
We had to cancel our reservation after our first night and moved to the Coventry Inn which is right across from it. Coventry Inn was cheaper and the room was clean and large.
review.negativeRemarks: Tear it down and rebuild it
review.locationRemarks: It's at a good location very close to the water

review.title: Close to pier 39...saves on parking costs.
review.reviewText: LIMITED parking spaces...about 14.  Felt like we were at the Indy 500 with all the traffic going by at all times of the day.
review.positiveRemarks: Location...saves on parking if you want to go to pier 39.

review.title: Great Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText:
When going through a lot of the reviews for this place, I was a little nervous about staying here.  It seems that a lot of people get hot headed and feel like they are cool if they can totally tell a company off in a review.  

This establishment was very nice.  First of all, the location was perfect.  If you will be riding the public transportation in SFO, this hotel was right near a couple major bus stops.  It is only a short ride away from Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradheli Square.  

The hotel was very clean and exactly what I expected for what I paid for.  If you are going to be cheap, don't come to SFO.  The hotels are relatively expensive and this was the cheapest around.  Remember people, we are rating a Hoard Johnson.  Not the Ritz.  The rooms were clean and tidy and I had to have a couple things brought up like extra soap and towels and they brought them up within just 2 minutes of me calling.  The staff was very nice and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great and the price was the cheapest around for a decent hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: I think it was a bit expensive but compared to many other hotels in SFO, it was relatively cheap.

review.title: Great location close to hop on/hop off tour
review.reviewText: San Francisco is a beautiful city Hojo's was reasonably priced for a room with 2 dbl beds and private bath. Very clean Close to restaurants We had a good stay
review.positiveRemarks: Price and accessibility to Bus tour
review.negativeRemarks: Had everything we needed
review.locationRemarks: Close to Hop on/hop off bus tourvroute cwhich goes all over San Francisco

review.title: Close to Marina district
review.reviewText: Nice and clean room, good shower. No excess noise at night Nice and close to the marina district with parking underneath. Breakfast provided and reasonably priced. Would stay here again
review.negativeRemarks: A little more for breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Pier for Alcatraz tour

review.title: A Good Basic
review.reviewText: Good location for a relatively reasonable price, particularly if you like walking. Choice of restaurants nearby and there is a bike rental shop 2 blocks away.
review.positiveRemarks: Great to have parking available at no extra charge, although there did not appear to be enough spaces for the number of rooms. We were lucky.
review.negativeRemarks: Secure gate or door at the bottom of the stairs leading up to the rooms.

review.reviewText: The Hotel and the staff is really nice. The only bad Point is that the parking lots are on a first come first serve baiss so it is not save that you will get one.

review.title: Get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: First, let me say I am tolerant, reasonable, and tried to match my expectation to the price. We stayed two nights and only spent time in the room to sleep. The location was decent because it was safe and a short walk to attractions. But, the hotel itself was well worn, in need of repair, and although clean its state of disrepair did not make it "feel" clean. We saved money but I would have coughed up enough to upgrade to a better hotel. Only way you would guess this was a HoJo was the sign above the front door. Parking was not an issue.
review.negativeRemarks: For the price, I would have at least expected towels that were not threadbare. Holes in the wall were a surprise. A general lack of upkeep and TLC.
review.locationRemarks: Piers are a reasonable walk or $8 taxi ride away. From there, you have access to everything.

review.title: Bed bugs... not recommended
review.reviewText: This place just lacks in all areas. There are only 12 parking spots for the 40 or so rooms, there is no elevator for the three floors that it has, the paint is peeling from the walls as well as wood trim that rotting off the walls, there is no fridge or micorwave. But wait, I was willing to put up with that since I was already there untill I see the bed bugs walking between the sheets and the matress... I grabbed my stuff and family and went down the street to another hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Just demolish it and start over.
review.locationRemarks: Fine arts palace and the Presidio park.

review.title: It's a good budget hotel
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for in San Francisco. There's no TV in the room and it is a bit far from most things. However, for an inn, it is relatively clean. Bed sheets and bathrooms were clean. That's very important. The so called "continental breakfast" is raw bananas with oatmeal and packaged sweet pastry. Don't expect too much for breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: It was cheap and it includes parking for those who drive.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast needs to be worked on.
review.locationRemarks: Lombard Crooked St. is about 8 blocks away after you climb up that hill. Ghirardelli Square is nearby.

review.title: You're going to have problems!
review.reviewText:
Parking limited to first come first parked. Parking limited to 12 spaces and they are always full. Extremely limited parking on the street. You will get a ticket!
All rooms on the 2nd & 3rd floors. NO ELEVATOR. STAIRS ONLY! Not accessible to mobility impaired folks.
Noisy partiers, street noise, and people dragging their luggage up outside stairs.
There is nothing within walking distance, and it's a $15 cab fare to Chinatown, and $15 back.
I highly recommend anywhere else in SF. There are many better choices.
review.negativeRemarks: Change those lumpy mattresses. Put refrigerators in the rooms. Get TVs that work. Put in an elevator. Buy a parking lot somewhere.
review.locationRemarks: Lousy location because of parking. Nothing within walking distance.

review.title: OK Place to Stay
review.reviewText: A little spending for an OK room. Would not stay again. Run down.

review.title: Bring your own linens, blankets, towels and soap.
review.reviewText: Open air motel off Lombard & Octavia. Hotel room smelled, hair and stains everywhere. We made it but will never stay again. Can't believe we paid over $100 to stay. Very nice staff working hard.

review.title: Just ok
review.reviewText: Nothing good or bad. Ok for the location. A bit expensive.

review.title: Ok for the price
review.reviewText: Good location and great price for being in the city (free parking = plus). Parking is a little bit cramped as there are only about 10 - 12 marked stalls (get there early). Not sure what was more disappointing the mildew on the shower curtain or the hole at the bottom of the wall where the baseboard should have been (was taped over with yellow & black caution tape). The room was comforatble with a good sized tv. The bathroom and sink space were a little cramped but functional. At the time of our stay it looked like they were repainting the outside of the building & doors. Hopefully they'll remodel the inside as the rooms are a bit dark.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great. Had we had more time we would have like to try some of the local bars/restaurants just up the street.
review.negativeRemarks: Towels could be cleaner as could the shower curtain. Rooms need more or brighter lighting.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants & bars

review.title: Close to many popular sights.
review.reviewText: It is a motor inn; therefore, one should not expect luxuriousness. My room was a little small, but it was well cleaned. The parking is limited; therfore, one must plan wisely before leaving the inn. Overall, I had no complaints!

review.title: Cheap place to crash
review.reviewText: Nothing special. Just q place to crash. Nice location. Breakfast wasn't really anything. Good location. Pay for what you get especially in downtown SF. Don't expect class.

review.title: Decent Location but SMOKEY!!!!
review.reviewText: The room was super smokey during the night. I kept waking up to waves of smoke drifting in. Not sure how. People were super loud all night and smoking outside the room. Just basic amenities and old appiances. I put the air on high but it only kicked in every hour or so. Was super hot. The desk guy said he would come up to help with the AC and the TV but he never did. Keep in mind that if on the second floor you have to carry your bags up 2 flights. It was hard on my 83 year old mom to climb the stairs. Parking very limited and super small spots. Decent location to walk to Union St and Chestnut. We booked 2 nights and left after the first night. My mom HATED it!.Luckily they refunded one night.

review.title: Tough upper Management
review.reviewText:
Room was clean but again,the common areas were dirty and ugly.
Accept for one all staff members and managers were long faced,overly serious and gave contradictory answers on same subjects when asked individually .
I would not stay there again.

review.title: Very dirty room, the walls were filthy.
review.reviewText: Thank goodness we had plans all weekend and didn't spend any time in the room!

review.title: Just pay a little more.
review.reviewText: Expected more!!!! It's like an easter egg hunt.Look carefully!

review.title: Pleasantly surprised re: some of the reviews I saw
review.reviewText:
Better than expected, not alot of parking, small hotel overall but fine for a few nights
very good value for the price I paid thru expedia
review.negativeRemarks: not a whole lot given the age and size of place
review.locationRemarks: plenty of bars and food in walking distance

review.title: not a very good place to stay,

review.negativeRemarks: Rooms cleanliness breakfast buffet
review.locationRemarks: Some very good areas to eat nearbuy.

review.title: Not Great
review.reviewText: This hotel was only okay!! I've stayed in this neighborhood and area many times, but at other locations. At 4AM there were people running up and down the halls, yet no one from management came out, as we checked in someone was leaving because they didn't like it, the parking was first come, first serve, and no offer of assistance, and not the cleaniest!
review.negativeRemarks: The staff needs to be more congenial
review.locationRemarks: Lots and lots of great walking neighborhoods.

review.title: Worth staying here!
review.reviewText: Facilities are nice, and very comfortable.... acoustics in passageway are awful! Anyone talking or laughing echos down the corridor. Unfortunately for us, we had a group next to us that came in at 2:30 in the morning and from then, until 4 AM were loud, raucous, rude and banged doors, in and out of their room, locked each other out, knocked banged and yelled. I stepped out into the hall and admonished their behavior, and then called the desk. They said they had already warned them, but would warn them again. It was awful and we got next to NO sleep. The hotel said they could not ask them to leave or throw them out. (there should be a fine system or some sort)... my next call would have been to the police.. AS far as the hotel and staff go, though, they are great! We had to park on the street a block away, but it was still free, so we were okay with that. Hopefully, next time we'll have quieter neighbors! Other people expressed their dismay the next day, too!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable, reasonable, free parking... close to everything! I would stay here again!
review.negativeRemarks: Cut down the corridor reverberations, add decaf coffee packets to the rooms.... some of us can't have regular! Thanks...
review.locationRemarks: If you're a walker, you could literally walk the whole pier area from here.

review.title: Don't do it!!!
review.reviewText: Place was a mess inside and out and I'm pretty sure it was prostitutes making noise all day and night outside unless people live there? Anyways, never again.

review.title: location, but would never stay again
review.reviewText: There are so many things bad about this place, so I'll just name a few. 1 Free parking, but a very limited amount of spaces. 2 no elevator, hope your bags are not heavy. 3 and probably the worst of all, this place is not secure at all, our second night there was a couple fighting all over the "hotel" on multiple floors and in the parking garage, breaking glasses throwing stuff at eachother and physically fighting in the parking garage and STAFF did nothing, guests had to call police!!!. If u want to sleep safely and worry free don't stay here.

review.title: Not worth the savings...
review.reviewText: No parking but a few first come first serve spaces. Breakfast was a pre wrapped breakfast roll. All but apple juice was out by 8 am. Stains on the bedding...

review.title: Seen better days.
review.reviewText: Location for my needs was good. Hotel very disappointing in that it was not kept well and up to date. Amenities limited and basics barley met. Desk staff was good.
review.positiveRemarks: location, safe and offered free but minimal breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Refurbishment and more attention to details.
review.locationRemarks: Location was occupied by mostly seedy looking motels and bars on a heavy traffic street with good bus service.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is located close to some nice restaurants. Relative clean rooms, the shared walking area could use more work on cleanliness, leaving sheets laying around and mops and buckets, not appealing. Try to avoid getting a room next to the ice machine, that sound gets to you after awhile.

review.title: Nice hotel for those with a budget
review.reviewText: My family and I stayed for 3 nights. After I had reserved a room at this hotel, I read that the parking spaces were limited (first come first served). So, when we got there, we were lucky enough to find a parking space and then we just left it there until we left. We were surprised as to how relaxed we could be walking around in that area without much to worry about. The marina was just 4 or 5 blocks away (that includes the path through a park). We also walked from Pier 39 to the hotel - it wasn't too bad for those who are in much better shape than us, but we made it work. The pick up for the Big Bus Sightseeing tour was just a few blocks away. We found it to be a decent location for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked that we weren't bothered. The staff were very nice - no complaints.
review.negativeRemarks: I think it would be a good idea for the hotel to upgrade some of their things, such as newer sheets and newer, softer towels.
review.locationRemarks: You don't need to go too far to find a good place to eat. Walgreens was just a few blocks away.

review.title: deceived me, it is the worst hotel I visited
review.reviewText:
I'm not happy.
1: I did not have a fridge and microwave-.

4: I had to pay for parking when they are supposed to be free. there was no space for more than 10 cars.

review.title: Good location not much else.
review.reviewText: Limited parking. Not very clean. Made beds when away not clean sheets. Had to ask for a towel every day never right amount. Lame breakfast.

review.title: Don't ever stay here
review.reviewText: No parking, filthy room, stained furniture, old cruddy hotel

review.title: Cheap hotel right in the center
review.reviewText: Cheap, Clean, pleasant staff. You don't need anything more if you just wan to sleep.

review.title: Nothing fancy, but convenient location
review.reviewText: Good price for a convenient location with free parking and free small continental breakfast. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean, but nothing fancy - bare bones. Blow dryer in room didn't work and they brought up a replacement right away. Had a room towards the middle of the unit so no noises from traffic on the street. The only issue was that there was a small group of partiers that were noisy at times and made it hard to sleep. Would still consider staying there again if money was an issue.

review.title: Very noisy and no parking!
review.reviewText: Be aware that there are only about 8 parking spaces for a hotel with about 50 rooms, do the math. The bedding was very old and the pillows the same. Not much of a continental breakfast.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText:
The hotel was close to restaurants, shops etc. However the hotel was noisy at all hours of the night, The hotel room door was so loud everything the door would shut. The parking was limited which was fine, because there was a notice on the front desk making you aware of it. But the condition of the parking area was sinking smelled like urine.
Wont be staying there again!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: The door to each hotel room and wash down the parking area.
review.locationRemarks: Close to restaurants, shops, beach.

review.title: Avoid at all Costs
review.reviewText: This is my first negative hotel review and this one is richly deserved. Breakfast was horrible and although parking is included for free they did not have any parking free and sent me to a paid lot blocks way. When I asked for reimbursement I was told that parking is "limited' which is nowhere stated in their web site. It was typical of this place of being totally dishonest in all regards
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was an undesirable unlabeled "cereal". Check pic of "healthy" breakfast, see washcloth repair of wall. Hallwyas were scary! NO PARKING!
review.locationRemarks: Hey it's San Francisco the foggy city-thousands of great things to do--just stay somewhere nice and not ruin your stay at this place.

review.title: Crack house accommodations
review.reviewText: Loud slamming doors. People yelling and no staff! Breakfast was so bad they could not give it away! Horrible stay regret I stayed here! Staff tried to sell everyone a bus tour wanting his $10.00 cut. Horrible!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything!

review.title: Nice hotel near some San Francisco attractions
review.reviewText: This hotel wasn't the best hotel but it had what I needed for my stay. Some fast food restaurants nearby, it's located at the front of one of the principal streets; there is a convenience store at the corner. The only thing I was a little worry about was the parking. They have only 10 or 12 parking spaces for all the rooms. So, if you don't get one, you have to parking on the street, where you have to pay for the parking. But in my case I was lucky to find a place inside the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the hotel because is well located. You just have to drive 10 to 15 minutes to any attraction in SF. And it has internet.
review.negativeRemarks: My room had no refrigerator but I don't know if this is a standard in all rooms.

review.title: Nice hotel, excellent location
review.reviewText: It was just fine. I was glad of the price Expedia was able to get me.
review.positiveRemarks: price, location, free parking, place to eat breakfast, hot water available with microwave, staff friendly & helpful, great heater
review.negativeRemarks: Missed hot tea in my room without the coffee smell/taste from the coffee maker- undrinkable! cleaner floor; rain going up and down stairs.
review.locationRemarks: great location -- the wonders of San Francisco!

review.title: Helpful stay, with one exception
review.reviewText: It would have been helpful to have a motel Ã¶ffice room" where guest could check in with airlines and print boarding passes. None available.

review.title: just OK. Missed the milk @ brake fast...just water
review.reviewText:
it was ok, for the price...
kinda far from fisherman's wharf...lot to walk.
review.negativeRemarks: towels not entirely clean. not a fridge in the room...
review.locationRemarks: no thanks.

review.title: You should NOT stay here
review.reviewText: I would give zero or even minus points if Expedia allowed me to. I was supposed to stay for 3 nights but found bed bugs on the second night. My friend was already bitten a lot. They never seem to change linen forever. Even if this hotel is the only place available in San Francisco, do NOT stay here. Never even think about that. Horrible experience.

review.title: Bad hotel
review.reviewText: There were stains in the beds, on the chairs, and in the bathroom. The staff was rude, and the free breakfast ended before 9:30. Do not recommend this to anyone.

review.title: a dump
review.reviewText: a dump !!
review.negativeRemarks: everything else

review.title: New Years Eve in San Francisco Marina District
review.reviewText: Room was clean. Place was Quiet. For a cheap stay in SF Marina District on New Years Eve, you probably can't beat it.
OK for the price & location
review.negativeRemarks: broken plaster next to tub, parking

review.reviewText: It was perfect for $68.00. Not great choices on Lombard street. Close to restaurants and shops.
review.negativeRemarks: Better bedding.

review.positiveRemarks: Close to key attractions like Fisherman's Wharf for tourists; Well connected by public transportation
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast counter could be improved

review.title: Park the car and ride the Metro
review.reviewText:
Location is good, as you can get the metro 1 block north, or two south. buy the daily pass and ride it everywhere. Breakfast in the lobby is limited at best, but the coffee was fresh. a few great options to eat breakfast a short walk west.

The small hotel is adequate, no frills for sure.
Ask for your towels as we had to remind them there were 4 of us. Beds were comfortable and clean. The staff did jump to serve when asked, kudos for that much.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: N/A

review.title: Dirty one
review.reviewText: Bugs on bed ,bite me lots of bumps and made me bad feeling and mode during wholw vacation

review.title: It was ok. And that's being nice.
review.reviewText: They weren't accommodating. I was put in a smoking room even though I requested non smoking. I requested to get out of it but they insisted I requested a smoking room. Either way the room wasn't very clean when I arrived. And everything else was whatever. I was better off getting a hotel room from better rated hotels.

review.title: I bought a sleeping bag
review.reviewText:
It was that bad. You pull up and it looks like a parking garage and the building itself is open so when you walk out of the room you're exposed to the elements â in San Francisco that means rain. When I checked in the staff was friendly enough but the room was on the second floor (third technically since the ground level is the parking) and there was no elevator â nor was there an offer to help me with my bags. The room was non-smoking, clearly designated as such, yet I was bombarded with the smell of smoke and there was ash on the carpet and one of the pillows. Switched rooms and while the smell was gone, I think the sheets/towels had once been white but were long past that point. I checked for bedbugs, found no signs, but figured I would just go and get a sleeping bag to sleep in on top of the bed.
I've stayed in Howard Johnsons before and while they are basic motels, I've never seen one in such bad shape. I would have switched hotels had the prices elsewhere been more than double and mostly were booked for a large science conference â which is why I was in town in the first place.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.

review.title: Good location/mediocre hotel
review.reviewText:
Starting with man at the counter checking us in at the office things were pretty dismal. He wasn't terribly friendly and before we were even finished with all the formalities he turned the television back on so he could go back to watching A Kardashian Christmas, or something really lame. As far as the room goes, at least the bed was ok. The bathroom floor was dirty, and so was the wall by the bed.
The continental breakfast was pretty bad. I didn't expect much since it was in the office of the motel, but they didn't even have coffee or a single piece of fresh fruit.
The woman who checked us out was at least a little more cheerful than the guy who checked us in.
The best thing about the motel was the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Service, cleanliness and the breakfast.

review.title: I feal like a tv show cops. Is creapy
review.reviewText: Was the worse hotel in my life.

Hotel doesn't guarantee parking even though my room when booked included free parking. I had to park on the street 2 of the 3 nights. Hotel has no lobby. Looks like a slum. Towels were thin. King size bed was very good. Breakfast was horrible.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything except maybe bed.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good if you want to be near the Golden gate bridge.

review.title: Unappealing exterior, rooms ok.
review.reviewText: Access to rooms direct from street, not very appealing. Limited parking. Staff friendly, tiny lobby, breakfast items in the morning. Rooms per se are comfortable and clean. Resources for refurbishing seem very limited.
review.negativeRemarks: Access to rooms, more parking.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, mainly other motels nearby.

review.title: Not worth it
review.reviewText: Don't stay here.

review.title: Convenient and reasonable
review.reviewText: Only problem for me was the lack of garage parking and the noise from the busy Lombard St. Get a room nearer the back of the hotel.

review.negativeRemarks: They need to be more accurate about the parking on site. There are only 12 parking spots for the entire hotel. More clarity req'd!

review.title: nice hotel,,very good location ..
review.reviewText: my stay was very comfortable here,,with all the major attractions r within 4-9 km distance..very nice place to stay...staff was very helpfull..
review.positiveRemarks: the best part is location n there staff...
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast items

review.title: Awful!
review.reviewText: Worst hotel experience of my life. Dirty, disgusting, loud, and unclean. Parking is very limited. Bathroom has mold.
review.negativeRemarks: Bugs, Mold, Dirtiness

review.title: Budget hotel
review.reviewText: Convenient location at a decent price...bathrooms need some work and towels need to be requested. Noisy location but safe.

review.title: Poor hotel close to Sf Bridge
review.reviewText:
I was most disappointed with the hotel. In my opinion I would say it was a transit hotel, because of the number of people that passed through in the eight days I resided there. I certainly would
would not go back again.
review.positiveRemarks: Only the bed. The staff were fine, helpful and pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: No comment.It would take too long.
review.locationRemarks: The location was fine,plenty cafes restaurants,and closeness too fishermans wharf and the San Francisco bridge.

review.title: small hotel, near attractions on very busy street
review.reviewText: stayed in san francisco for 5 nites, bathroom was dirty, linens were old and dirty, carpeting was worn and dirty
review.negativeRemarks: parking, cleanliness, and a remodel
review.locationRemarks: near center of marina district of san francisco, plenty of restaurants and shops nearby

review.title: Spartan Accomodations
review.reviewText: There is so much to do and see in San Francisco that our overall experience was good. However a lot of the pleasure was offset by the hotel's poor parking faclities. There are nowhere near enough spaces for all residents. At the end of a day of sightseeing the last thing you want to do is spend an hour or more looking for street parking and then have to walk back to the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to many attractions in San Francisco, particularly Fisherman's Wharf. All restaurants in the area were terrific.
review.negativeRemarks: See comments above regarding parking. The continental breakfast facility is a joke. There is no elevator. Smoking should be banned in all rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Lombard St. location is great for easy access to the Wharf, GG Bridge, Embarcadero, etc.

review.title: Dumpy hotel on a busy street.
review.reviewText: Office closed when I got there at 3:00 PM. We had to wait for the clerk to get back from????? The room smelled musty, the furniture was stained and ugly. The bathroom had mold around the tub. There were clean sheets and the beds were fairly comfortable. It needed some TLC.
review.positiveRemarks: It was in a fairly central location.
review.negativeRemarks: A new coat of paint, some potted plants and some updated furniture.
review.locationRemarks: Close to tour bus stop.

review.title: OK, but what's the name of that hotel?
review.reviewText: I would not particularly recommend this just because many in that area must be at least its equal. I wish Expedia or the hotel had let us know in advance that the Ramada Inn where we had registered three weeks ago became Howard Johnson's before our arrival. We drove up and down down the street in that medium-priced hotel area late at night looking for Ramada and had to phone to find out that the name had changed.

review.title: Terrible!
review.reviewText: Dirty and smelly! Bath tub was disgusting. Rooms smell like smoke with musty odor. Awful place to stay.

review.title: Well located at a decent price for San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is close to several bus routes making it easy to get around. Also has limited free parking - somewhat of a rarity in San Francisco.

Bed and bathroom were decent and fairly clean. Continental breakfast included - but no fruit. Staff was helpful, but not very friendly.

One caveat - all rooms are up one or two flights of stairs - no elevator.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs some sprucing up (dead plants in planters just don't add any ambiance). Staff could work on people skills, smile a little more and be friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Several good restaurants near by (Mel's Diner is two blocks away). Short walk to Union Street and Fort Mason.

review.title: Good position
review.reviewText: No elevators, but staff did help with all our heavy bags up 2 flights of stairs. Towels were ridiculously thin and old. Needs an upgrade for the price.
review.negativeRemarks: New towels and install elevator

review.title: Poor for a ramada
review.reviewText: Bedding was old thin sheets big stain in bed spread asked for different one never got. Overall the room needed a good cleaning and new bedding won't go back.

review.title: Not at all what was expected
review.reviewText:
1) In our request for a San Francisco stay, we asked for a hotel near Fisherman's Wharf. This place is a $10 taxi ride from Fisherman's Wharf.
2) Initial impression is decent. After all, Ramada has a good reputation. However . . .
3) Room was dirty, shower curtain rod installation on bathroom walls was a botched, ugly job. Carpet was stained and appeared to not have been vacuumed for some time.
4) There was insufficient parking. If parking lot full, guests forced to seek non-existing parking spots on nearby streets.
5) Free breakfast was minimal, at best.
6) Positives: Staff was pleasant and bed linen and towels were clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Easily located by car or taxi.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to ethnic restaurants.

review.title: close to train station
review.reviewText: Needs updating...very tired looking. Gentlemen at the front desk weren't really all that helpful nor did they know their way around the neighbourhood. Sangeeta, on the other hand, was extremely helpful and knew how to guide us to the various attractions that we wanted to see with the least difficulty and gave us excellent directions on which bus routes to take.
review.positiveRemarks: Besides Sangeeta nothing really stood out.
review.negativeRemarks: The whole hotel, inside and out, needs refurbishing!
review.locationRemarks: IF YOU GET THE CORRECT DIRECTIONS AND A GOOD MAP, YOU CAN NAVIGATE AROUND THE WATERFRONT EASILY!

review.title: Hotel is old and smells.
review.reviewText: Zero amenities. Employees are however, friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Tear down the place and build a new one.
review.locationRemarks: Long walk to the beach.

review.title: Affordable option close to Fort Mason
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised at how nice this reasonably priced motel was. The room was bright, had free wifi and the staff were very helpful. It is not upscale by any means but was comfortable and conveniently located.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the location, free wifi and parking.
review.negativeRemarks: The towels were pretty stiff.
review.locationRemarks: Fort Mason, Shopping and coffee shops on Union Street. Great views of Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz close by.

review.title: Dump of a hotel
review.reviewText:
three lights were not working in the first room I was given
the lobby is the size of a bathroom
there is no A/C

review.title: Poor Hotel Service from the beginning.
review.reviewText:
I walked in the door and realized that the parking was first-come-first-serve and was not happy about this. To top this off the IT guy said with a sneering tone in his voice that is the rules of this hotel.

Asked the person at the front desk to call me a cab. The person called me a cab but never told what company or gave me a number to call the cab company to get back to the hotel. Poor service there....
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing, the bed was hard, a lot of noise outside and service was terrible.
review.negativeRemarks: Service
review.locationRemarks: Good location for its price and some nice restaurants nearby.

review.title: Ok in a real pinch
review.reviewText:
I was on a business trip to several locations so my bag was quite heavy and upon check-in I learned there was no elevator - Yikes! Granted, I only needed to climb two sets of stairs but with a heavy bag, a purse and a computer backpack I was not happy about having to schlep this up.

The room was clean and comfortable. However, the common areas were filthy. There were cigarette butts on the [exterior] stairs and hallways and even on top of a fire extinguisher. Additionally, though I don't mind having my room open right to the outside the walkways were poorly lit and I felt a little uncomfortable when I arrived back to my room after a late night work event.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning of the outdoor common areas and having guests not smoke all over these outdoor spaces.

review.title: Very pleasant hotel staff
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is very convenient because you can walk to the Fisherman Wharf, it is 20 blocks but the neighborhood is very secure. Everything at the hotel was nice, it is not a luxury hotel but for the price it is really good. I will recommend this hotel to someone who do not want to expend too much money in a stay at San Francisco. The breakfast was really good and it is included in the price.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the staff and the free breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanness of the room and bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great and there are many good restaurant around, the neighborhood is very safe, you can walk late at night feeling secure.

review.title: overall it was ok. Mold on the shower curtain
review.reviewText: The overall experience was okay. The room was comfortable and the staff was helpful. The only thing wrong was some mold on the shower curtain. Other than that, it was fine.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was good for the things that we like to do while in the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Make sure the bathrooms are cleaned well.
review.locationRemarks: Bus route was close to get us to the things we like to do. Marina and Fishermann's Wharf close by.

review.title: Hotel needs upgrade work
review.reviewText: To have the hotel listed as a Ramada is somewhat embarrassing. The room was neat but the towels were old and an off-white color. The bath was redone but the shower curtain had mildew along the bottom. Also there were no handrails in the shower. There were spots on the wall that could have been cleaned when cleaning the room. The entrance to the check-in reception area and the stairs to the rooms need to be pressure-washed, everything felt like it wasn't clean.
review.positiveRemarks: The only nice attraction about the hotel was the "free parking" available on a first-come basis.
review.negativeRemarks: With little money invested, the rooms could be very nice. Upgrade - towels, bedspread and curtains.
review.locationRemarks: Good location for walking - Palace of Fine Arts within 15 minute walk.

review.title: accessible to transportations.......
review.reviewText:
taxis come in easy. good location for transportation.

office and breakfast nook were not very clean. had to go upstairs carrying our luggage. no elevator.

the students who were assigned in the evenings were helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: continental breakfast was decent. it had newspaper accessible to patrons.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness can be improved. better courtesy can be stressed among the staff members.
review.locationRemarks: nice little restaurants nearby for dining...proximity to fisherman's wharf. safe area.

review.title: DISGUSTING
review.reviewText: our room was very run down and had mold on the shower curtain, the towels felt like you were drying yourself with a scrubbrush, the continental breakfast was disgusting..stale cereal and warm milk...no fruit to be had....this place was also in not a very nice part of town...very dirty!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaner coffee pots and softer towels..better wifi

review.title: Nice facility but off the beaten path
review.reviewText: Clean. Hotel staff efficient. Liked the wifi. But the location was so far from San Francisco that it should not be listed in the San Francisco search. On the map it doesn't look far but with the traffic an complicated roads, a trip into the city that looks like it would take about 20 minutes takes about an hour.
review.negativeRemarks: Not for smokers. Just a small dirty bench, down stairs, next to the dumpster provided. Had a problem with the Wifi during an important training sessi
review.locationRemarks: That is the main problem. Nothing within walking distance. Not even the small town. No shuttle service to San Francisco.

review.title: Cheap, easy, nice staff
review.reviewText: This place is great if you're on a budget and don't have a car. We arrived and as expected there were NO spaces, so we parked on the street overnight fully expecting a ticket (luckily, we didn't get one). The next morning however, the desk attendant was nice enough to block off a free space in the lot with his car for us. Definitely let us breathe easier the rest of the trip. Location is good and a decent walk to the Wharf. #30 bus is also closeby and takes you to the must-see stops (City Lights, Chinatown, AT&T Park) if all the hills tire you out. It's not a fancy hotel by any means, but we left satisfied.
review.negativeRemarks: New towels.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to almost everywhere from here. Mel's Diner up the street was our breakfast go-to.

review.title: Not a nice hotel. Too small for families
review.reviewText: Not clean, small, LOUD!!!! Did not fell safe at this hotel. Very disappointed.
