review.positiveRemarks: Not a thing. Worst hotel I have ever stayed at.
review.negativeRemarks: Complete renovation!!!

review.title: Premises not cleaned. Noisy. Cramped parking.
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was unclean. The ice machine kept us up at night. The plants in lots were all dead. There was trash on the floors walking to our room. There was no fitness room which I believe was advertised. Bed was uncomfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs an overall updating.

review.title: Location is the only thing it has going for it.
review.reviewText: Location is good. Needs some major money put into to make it ok to stay in.
review.negativeRemarks: Spend some money on your hotel. For how much you spend the hole in your bathroom should be patched.
review.locationRemarks: Great places to walk and eat.

review.title: Disappointing old and not clean
review.reviewText:
We did sleep well but rooms are old, carpets worn out and bathroom not clean
Need to be lucky or patient to use complementary breakfast room because only two tables in there.
review.positiveRemarks: It was the only available hotel for our budget
review.negativeRemarks: Improve cleaning standards or replace carpet and repaint rooms. Increase size of breakfast area to allow more than 8 people to have breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, frequent city busses to downtown just one block away Close to Marina shopping area.

review.title: Good location.. and nothing more...
review.reviewText: It is well located. You can reach FishermanÂ´s Warf, Chinatown or dowtown in 10-20 minutes by foot. But it is too expensive for what it offers. The breakfast is terrible and you have only TWO tables. A client was waiting on the line to get a table and when he got it and tried to take his food he was prevented to by a rude staff because the time was over (!!). The parking is small and if you come back late your car will have to stay outside (and parking in San Francisco is not an easy task ). The room is small and it was not very well cleaned. The internet was terrible.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking and breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Excellent.

review.title: Good for the price.
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for. Nothing extra good or bad to write about. An average hotel with an average breakfast.

review.title: 45th anniversary trip
review.reviewText: We began our marriage 45+ years ago in the bay area and decided to visit San Francisco to celebrate our 45th year of marriage. The staff at the Ramada Limited were very helpful in guiding us in bus usage, and good meal places near by. The room was excellent, clean and very quiet considering the location on Lombard street. We would certainly stay there again and are in fact considering doing so. The price was wonderful and the ability to park our car at no cost was an added benefit (it is first come first served)).
review.negativeRemarks: We have no suggestions.
review.locationRemarks: the location was great and bus service was just a block and a half away. We ate at some local eateries, namely Mels Diner, The Silver Cloud.

review.title: hotel in the city
review.reviewText: the staff was very helpful. the helped me jump start my car after i had left the lights on all night

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was right on Lombard street and there were many great restaurants and shops nearby. They had limited parking and so we left our car there and took buses everywhere. San Fran is a city that offers great public transportation and we used it. Room was small but adequate. Lobby very small and breakfast limited. Staff very helpful and efficient. Not very handicap accessable due to configuration making first floor of rooms up 16 steps from garage and lobby. Knew this going in so was prepared for it.
review.positiveRemarks: Wonderful location and nearness to bus lines.
review.negativeRemarks: More parking would be helpful due to restrictions of street parking. Don't know where they could find more parking since they utilized all available.
review.locationRemarks: Near to all the great sights of the city. Plenty to do and wonderful food everywhere. Not far from Fishermen's Wharf and other attractions.

review.title: Not good.
review.reviewText: It was gross. And they lied throughout our stay about the wifi. It never worked in our room. I would definitely not recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: It was dark, dingy and not very clean. No wifi.
review.locationRemarks: Nice area, but sketchy at night.

review.title: Disappointing for the price
review.reviewText:
Location was good, close to bus stops and entertainment within walking distance. We knew we couldn't expect much for a 2 star rating, but at the heafty nightly rate plus fees and tax you can't help but raise expectations a little. We swallowed the price point relying on the included parking spot. What they don't tell you is that parking is first come/first serve. Lucky we made it in to town relatively early on a Friday (5pm), we got the last spot in the less then 20 spot lot. We vowed to take transit for the rest of our stay and leave the car in the covered spot.
Room seemed to be ok with cleanliness until I went to use a towel with lipstick stains on it, all the towels and face cloths were stained and dirty looking (what would be in my cleaning rags collection at home).
I would recommend a different hotel at the same price point even if they don't include parking,(unless your planning on an early check-in on a week day and can bring your own face towels!
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance to fort mason and chestnut street entertainment, parks an bus stops.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean towels/wash cloths in room.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to fort mason and chestnut street entertainment, parks an bus stops. Voodoo lounge!

review.title: Strategic location, value for money.
review.reviewText: Front office staff was very friendly and helpful when we checked in. Hotel located near to a lot of SF attractions. Could be better if more parking spaces are available to guests.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking space
review.locationRemarks: Strategically located in SF
review.userLocation: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

review.title: Good choice if you have low expectations
review.reviewText: The room cleanliness was mediocre as were the amenities. We got clean towels and had our bed made everyday and the waffle iron in the lobby made delicious waffles. However, the cable box was mounted BEHIND the TV so we had to stand on the bed or the dresser to change the channel. The worst part of our 5-night stay was the overly firm bed. My back was in such horrible shape by the last night that I contemplated sleeping in the chair. This place would be good for an overnight stay in a pinch, but that bed was awful.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location in Pacific Heights, right on Lombard. Oh, and the waffles.
review.negativeRemarks: The cleanliness could be a little better, the TV cable box needs to be where the remote can access it, and the mattresses need to be a little softer.

review.title: Hotel in Marina area
review.reviewText: Dirty hotel. Too small. Good location. But needs to be cleaner.

review.title: Rude staff
review.reviewText: They decided to paint the stairs in the middle of the night, yet didn't bother telling any of the guests. Myself and another guest tried to get down to the office for the Continental breakfast, but stairway was taped off. No notes or alternate route posted. So we tore tape and walked down the stairs anyway (paint was dry). On my way back up to my room, the Manager was just showing up for work (9am) and started yelling at other people for walking on the stairs. Continental breakfast was useless. With all the other options in town for around the same price, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Stay away from this place. I know I will!
review.negativeRemarks: Staff that appreciated their customers.

review.title: Not a great value
review.reviewText:
"Hotel" is in fair condition. Rooms are ok, AC works. Rooms are clean, except towels which were washed but still all stained and old.

Location is convenient to explore fishersman's wharf, golden gate bridge and all north of SF.

Parking extremely limited as is all SF.

Breakfast is a joke. if you're lucky you can get a bad tasting coffee. I stayed three nights and only managed to grab a coffee and a toast in total.

For 150+ bucks a night this is terrible value. This would be a great place to stay for 100 bucks max.
review.negativeRemarks: PRICE, breakfast

review.title: Convenient location deceptive branding
review.reviewText: Welcoming friendly desk staff and good location. A very tired and basic motel with no amenities. A couple of good local breakfast options preferable to sitting in reception with toasted waffles (included breakfast!)
review.negativeRemarks: Knock down and re- build
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fishermans Wharf

review.title: If You Want Cheap, Stay Here
review.reviewText:
My expectations were already low for this hotel but after my stay here, it gets an even lower rating. The continental breakfast is stocked with the cheapest quality food, the bread they offered was a brand name I hadn't even heard of, probably purchased at the 99 Cent Store, and the coffee was also some no-name brand. It was so bad in fact, that my husband threw his coffee out and I have never seen him do that, he's not picky at all.

We never got to sleep in on our vacation in SF because the rooms face each other in a narrow courtyard making every door slam, every word, every footstep amplified. We stayed three nights and every morning by 5 or 6:00am we heard children screaming and running in the courtyards, luggage wheels being raked across the pavement, people slamming doors and speaking and laughing in booming acoustics.

The pillows were tiny, sparsely filled and cheap and the towels were threadbare and riddled with holes. The bathrooms were actually decent with granite flooring and a white, clean looking tub, the place wasn't dirty, just cheap looking, The toilet paper was thin one-ply and we only had a half a roll to use for the entire stay. Maid service didn't bother to restock us.

The parking lot only has about 15 spots and we had to park on the street and move the car by 9am the next day. I did secure a spot the next day but only after waiting an hour and a half to get one.

Their only saving grace is the service, the staff is friendly, helpful and courteous.

review.title: Free Parking? Really!
review.reviewText: Don't let the free parking advertisement fool you! Free for about 10 cars, the rest have to find parking on the street if you can.

review.title: Great budget place
review.reviewText: Cleaner every day .fresh towels and toliletries every day .nice breakfast
review.positiveRemarks: Near to fisher man wharf and bus routes
review.negativeRemarks: Noise of people dragging luggage
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location

review.title: Dark, Cramped with Lombard Street Traffic Noise
review.reviewText: Didn't expect much given the cramped quarters of this part of town. There is a limited amount of free parking, which was a plus in the city. The courtyard was dark and depressing and our window overlooked a heavily-trafficked stairwell. We requested a non-smoking room, which we received but it smelled of cigarette smoke. There was a large amount of water soaked into the carpet in front of the sink and while promised the internet connection was inoperable during our entire one-night stay. In the future I would be willing to pay a little more for a room with better exposure.
review.positiveRemarks: The price, the parking, the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a more reliable WiFi connection.
review.locationRemarks: The Golden Gate bridge, Pier 39, Lombard Street (the crookedest street in the world) are both great places to visit if you're into the tourist thing.

review.title: San Francisco hotel in good location for our needs
review.reviewText: not bad for the price...clean...close to shipping piers... tight parking but adequate....didn't care for the stairs....(no elevator)........nice continental breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: put in an elevator!!!!
review.locationRemarks: close to Fisherman's wharf...and cruise lines

review.title: Too noisy
review.reviewText: You can hear all the cars and people all night long.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom needs updating
review.locationRemarks: Busy street. Near the Piers.

review.title: Disappointing hotel stay
review.reviewText: There was a lack of cleanliness. The floor wasn't vacuumed properly, ice bucket had dirt buildup along inside edges, and sheets had stains. The bathroom was clean and seemed to have been updated recently. The parking is free, but there are only about 10 to 12 spaces available, so if you don't get lucky with a spot you have to resort to finding parking on the street. We were lucky and got parking for the three nights we stayed there.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked that the bathroom was up to date and clean. It was also a short drive to many of the attractions, which was convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: I think a more thorough cleaning should be done before a guest checks in to make the experience more comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Golden Gate Bridge, Palace of Fine Arts, and De Young Museum.

review.title: Basic Hotel
review.reviewText: A clean basic hotel with no extras close to the wharf.

review.title: Won't do it again
review.reviewText: I understand this is SF and hotels are more expensive, but I expected a place where you feel comfortable and secure. Neither happened for me. It's kinda noisy and also had a weird (not bad, just not standard) smell. Parking is really limited. Had it not been for a place to crash only, I've been really unpleasant staying for more time
review.negativeRemarks: Very limited parking

review.title: Convenient Dodgy Location
review.reviewText: Being in San Francisco in a bit of a dodgy area, we found it alarming that the reception room, just off the street was locked most of the time when they were there as they had 24 hour service and that the stairs leading to the rooms were right on the sidewalk, being open to anyone off the street. A few door away one of the homeless was sleeping in 'her' doorway as we saw her there every night. When we got over that, it all seemed to work well. It was a convenient location in that a bus in the next street took us to the Wharf (with one change) where we were able to catch a cable car to downtown. The wharf was where it all happened and restaurants were great. Tour buses picked us up right outside the front. It was very noisy at night with suitcases rolling by on uneven tiles with people coming and going. The parallel street behind (Chestnut) had a nice shopping and restaurant area a couple of blocks along.
review.positiveRemarks: Free high speed internet in the room and free off street covered parking.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were too open to anyone off the streets.
review.locationRemarks: Dodgy location but it was quite convenient.

review.title: my hotel stay
review.reviewText:
MY main complaint about this hotel was the cigarette smoke ,I do not smoke nor does my wife and kids so we were in a no smoking room, however they let people smoke out side the rooms and smoke was always coming in under and around the door so we always had smoke in our room.
There was 4 of us in the room and ever day they would only give us 3 towels.
For breakfast they basically only had waffles with only one waffle maker and you had to stand in line for up to 20 minutes just to make one waffle.

review.title: ok for an overnight stay.
review.reviewText:
Carpet needed shampooing. Better towels needed.
Better soap and shampoo needed.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: was ok

review.title: The Ozzies
review.reviewText: Very quiet - family style hotel - walking distance to Ffishermans Wharf - great - thankyou!
review.negativeRemarks: Not Applicable
review.locationRemarks: convenient to Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Basicaly a nice hotel.
review.reviewText:
We booked the hotel based on its location and the fact it has free parking, plus free breakfast.

Parking has limited space and is first come first served. I was able to find a spot when checking at 6:00 PM, not sure if others are able to find spot when checkin late.

Breakfast is provied in the reception room with very limited space, so it can be crowded and the variety is very basic,

Room was clean and I was basically fine with it.

Spend one night there basicaly no problem.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: It is a quite nice experience. free parking and free breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: the tap is not that good.
review.locationRemarks: just ok

review.title: Basic and needs much more TLC from the staff.
review.reviewText: Reasonably located in walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and has car parking on a first come first saved basis. However it is on a busy road and can get noisy. Staff were not overly helpful, many of them preferring to watch the tv or were engrossed with their laptop. Rooms were ok, with the basics like a comfy bed, clean sheets, clean sink but overall cleanliness of the room and other areas was poor. Cleaners either need to buck up their ideas or be changed. Carpet was filthy in our room and did not get vacuumed during our 4 day stay and bathroom floor was not cleaned either - yuk. Buffet breakfast was basic, coffee and orange juice / bananas ok, but again the general cleanliness was very poor. This hotel could be ok with a bit of TLC and if staff spent time working / cleaning and not being lazy then could easily be improved.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall cleanliness of rooms and breakfast area, lack of staff attention
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf but on a busy road - Lombard Street.

review.title: Dont waste your night here
review.reviewText: This hotel is located on a busy and loud street. That noise can be heard in your room as is the noise from other guest talking and walking up and down the stairs in the center of the hotel. Late night entrances are bound to wake you as they did us every night. A hot shower is about the only good thing i can say for this place. Breakfast area was dirty too.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Good hotel for your money
review.reviewText: For our family it worked out good. It is a long walk to pier 39, but doable. The free parking is nice but limited parking, one night we had to park out on the street and got a 63.00 dollar parking ticket, the hotel staff said we could park there. It's a safe neighborhood. It would have been great if we didn't get that ticket.
review.negativeRemarks: Got a parking ticket when the parking lot was full and staff told us where to park on the street
review.locationRemarks: Good location but a far walk for tourist sites

review.title: great location, needs clean linens
review.reviewText: the hotel is ok. I recommend that they focus on providing clean sheets and towels.
review.negativeRemarks: dirty sheets and old towels
review.locationRemarks: great location, between the Golden Gate Bridge and Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: fine
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, good free breakfasts, good location. The price is right.

review.title: Good hotel to Stay in SF
review.reviewText: Perfect location, good rate and have everything which we need for stay.
review.negativeRemarks: parking, but its ok

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: The recipients stated wit was great and comfortable

review.title: good deal
review.reviewText: If you look for 5 stars hotel you will probably be disappointed. If, however, you look for a nit place to sleep it is the right place. I found a clean room, helpful staff and wonderful location.

review.title: you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: The term "you get what you pat for" applies to this hotel. For one night it's passable, there were roudy guests #girls# laughing running and carousing till past 1:00 a.m.

review.title: Not impresses
review.reviewText: Simply, do not stay here for any reason. Service was poor and the walls are paper. I've never complained about a hotel before but we had to in this case.
review.negativeRemarks: Terrible area, room was not upgraded or clean. No working phone in room.

review.title: very bad hotel
review.reviewText: Really hard beds like a rock. The Front door the outside light was coming throw and outside noise. People making noise all night long. Parking suxk
review.negativeRemarks: The bed
review.locationRemarks: Good area

review.title: Not the best experiance
review.reviewText: Our room was right on a busy street and we could hear all the noise. The room was dark and a little dingy looking. The desk clerk didn't do something right because when the next shift came on the rented our room to other guest and it startled us when someone opened our door. It got straightened out but we were just getting dressed to go out. I love to go to San Francisco but I won't being staying there again. :(

review.title: Never stay here!!!!
review.reviewText:
We booked a room for 5 people & when we got there, there were only 2 small double beds for 5 of us to fit in. We were told they had no pull out beds & we would just have to fit in the beds. The toilet overflowed & flooded the carpet. We gad to keep asking for nore towels & toilet paper as they bever supplied enough in the room.
It was by far the worst hotel we have ever stayed in & considering it was quite pricey we feel completely ripped off. I would NEVER recommend this hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: Absolutely everything!!
review.locationRemarks: Good location.

review.title: Ramada in San Francisco left me wanting
review.reviewText:
Motels supply rooms and it was relatively clean as far as it was concerned. The small things are what counts between such places and the small things were disappointing. No decaf coffee ever for the in-room coffee pot, no paper, the television need two different remotes to operate, the shower temperature control was reversed, hot water was not always easy to come by and finally when departing I could not get a copy of the charge slip or a receipt. Can you believe it, no receipt!

Like I wrote, its the small things and this Ramada Inn missed so many I am just disappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: Inattention to any detail at all
review.locationRemarks: Lombard street in the Marina district. Convenient to many things in and near the Wharf.

review.title: Hotel nightmare
review.reviewText:
Unfriendly staff when checking in - no elevator - stairwell open to public - dirty dirty rooms - bathtub dirty - toilet filthy under rim - hairs on the sheets and pillows of the bed. It was so bad we tried other hotels but everything was booked - slept on top of the bed and checked out the next day.
Only redeeming feature was good wifi access.
review.negativeRemarks: dirt dirt and more dirt
review.locationRemarks: ok

review.title: Ok but not super clean
review.reviewText: Our sheets were bloodstained which was kinda gross. Everything worked ok, the breakfast was fine but there was no rollaway bed avaliable for our 3rd child. It served our needs b/c we were out all day but the actual hotel is kinda rundown looking. Perhaps b/c it is light pink and a bit dirty.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: 30 min walk to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: a place to sleep and shower
review.reviewText: If all you want is a place to sleep and a bathroom, you got it. Helpful nice people working the front desk. Morning coffee and waffles was kind of nice. Who comes to SF to spend a lot of time in their room? For that reason it was ok.
review.negativeRemarks: I clean my cars with better towels than theirs.
review.locationRemarks: Not really very close to the wharf. Need a cab to get there.

review.title: Choose another hotel!
review.reviewText: The television in the room had most of the channels "locked out" , I called twice, once a hotel employee came to the room said "Yes, the channels are locked out" and claimed he would call their cable service and get the access code - that never happened - on the second call they said they would come to the room in 10 minutes - they did not come. They don't have adequate parking at the facility for the guests, however they really did try to accomodate allowing us to double park in the garage leaving them the key for the one night we had a rental car. The room was up two huge flights of stairs (no elevator). The bed was comfortable, actually a nice size. There was trash behind the door when it was closed - guess the cleaning staff does not close the door to sweep. Other than than the general cleanliness was good. They advertise a continental breakfast and then give two very small tables for the entire hotel to eat at - we chose to go and pay for breakfast elsewhere. The hotel staff arranged for our return ride to the airport and we had to give the hotel $10.00 for the service - the shuttle was late and the driver had an attitude. This hotel is not on the bus line and is several miles from the Wharf. Would not recommend and would not return.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was actually large and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Television channnels "locked out", poor service in this regard, lots of stairs.
review.locationRemarks: Heavy traffic, not on the bus line, a couple miles from the Wharf

review.title: Below expectations
review.reviewText:
We booked this hotel because of the Ramada name, but It is rather a motel then a hotel. Rooms are facing a narrow courtyard, very little natural light.
Location is not bad - close to Marina and within 10 minutes ride to the Peer 39.
Breakfast room which is a reception area is crowded, only 2 tables avaiable.
Off- hours there is only one person in attendance for the whole place.
review.locationRemarks: Location is not bad - close to Marina and within 10 minutes ride to the Peer 39

review.title: Not suitable for handicapped or disabled
review.reviewText: We were very disappointed that the hotel had no rooms on the ground level, no elevator and very limited parking. They advertised having "Handicap Access". My husband has bad knees and it was very difficult for him to walk up the steep stairs. The only Handicap access was ONE handicap parking space. Sorry I cannot recommend this hotel unless you are young and not disabled.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is a little old, no refrigerator, great location, walking distance to the beach, Pier 39, shops, and scenic places. Parking is the main problem here. Some of the staff were nice and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Close to the places we wanted to visit

review.title: WARNING!!!!
review.reviewText: There is no elevator for this hotel. My daughter and I had lug our suitcases up two flights of stairs with no help from the front desk. Due to the weight of my daughter's suitcase, the handle broke on it leaving us with huge frustration on our return flight home. Also, when I checked out, the front desk person tried to get me to sign a Credit Card receipt for 432.00 dollars. He printed the receipt, folded it in half and then told me to sign it. When I questioned the charges, he told me to never mind and I didn't have to sign it after all. Very shady!!!
review.negativeRemarks: The management and the overall quality of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Location was convenient.

review.title: Location ok, near busstop
review.reviewText: Friendly and helpfull staff during evening shifts, morning lady looked moody during 3 mornings. Not enough space to have breakfast, only 8 seats for whole motel. Location OK, near busstop 30, though easy going to fishermans wharf and union square. Free car parking under motel.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms dirry carpet, especially in corners
review.locationRemarks: Near busstop 30, easy going to Fishermans wharf and union square.

review.title: Look for better.
review.reviewText: This hotel felt and looked like a prison camp. On arrival the reception guy was huffing and puffing and rude to his staff which wasn't a great first impression. The room smelt of smoke, it was out-dated and in need of a good refurbishment. The walls were paper thin. The ice machine needs a good service, as it self combusts in the middle of the night. The reception area was being refurbished as we stayed there, which looked nice as we left, so if they are working their way through to the rooms, that can only be a positive thing. Breakfast was ok, it had to be delivered because of the reception renovations, which was a bonus for us, but i felt sorry for the poor bloke that had to deliver them all! There isn't many spaces in the car park, so it's first come first serve. Location was ok, a 20 to 30 minute walk to fishermans whalf.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise
review.locationRemarks: Location wasn't too bad

review.title: last option
review.reviewText: Hotel is old and not very comfortable, the reception is to small and the staff was not on the desk
review.negativeRemarks: the hotel itself
review.locationRemarks: to crowded

review.title: No Frills but Tidy and Comfortable
review.reviewText: We were very wary about staying in this hotel after reading more recent reviews, but for a family of five (three children) it was fine as a place to rest after a day of doing tourist things. While not much to look at from the outside, it was okay. The room was clean and there was not much foot traffic past the room, mainly due to it being upstairs as opposed to on the ground level. The staff were helpful when we called from the airport to sort out transport to the hotel, giving us the best option and price - accurately. On our arrival they were happy for us to go to the room, as it was ready, early and settle in. We were also able to store our luggage, etc, in a safe (locked) area on the day of our departure until we left for the airport. There was some excessive noise by other hotel guests one night of our stay. The breakfast is very basic and due to renovations this was delivered to the room each morning and was always on time and accurate.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were reasonably helpful and the room was kept tidy throughout our four day stay.
review.negativeRemarks: The way noise carries when others are outside talking, etc. The breakfast could have been better, but give benefit of doubt due to renovations.
review.locationRemarks: With three children under 12 we were able to walk to main tourist attractions, as well as handy to cable car/muni transport stops.

review.title: san fran
review.reviewText: advertising on line about free parking, but only 16 spaces, otherwise have to find spot on street, which after 4 p.m. is impossible.
review.negativeRemarks: parking, noise, no place to sit for breakfast.

review.title: Do not rent
review.reviewText: Dirty common area, no elevator so you have to lug luggage up two flights, little to no parking, dirty carpet in the room, loud hvac, the door had a thumb size gap so all the noise and light came righ into the room. All in all don't recommend
review.locationRemarks: Good location but poor parking

review.title: location location
review.reviewText: Location and free parking are all this hotel has going for it.
review.negativeRemarks: Room condition was poor, breakfast was poor, service was poor.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything including public transport.

review.title: Ramada very limited
review.reviewText: Noisy, Advertised free parking but lot was full and had to park off property at additional cost. People continoulsy smoking in inner corridor with smoke wafting up to rooms above,
review.negativeRemarks: just about everything
review.locationRemarks: good location!

review.title: great neihborhood
review.reviewText: I liked the location. It was close to several neigborhoods that had great shops and restaurantsbars. Met a lot of great people.

review.title: Good for price
review.reviewText: This is a low cost place, but there was nothing wrong with it at all, and the people were very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: car was broken into at night

review.title: Ramada limited
review.reviewText: Great service and friendly staff. Location was excellent and close to the metro system. Hotel had limited parking but this was not a concern due to fact we used public transportation. Rooms were on outside corridor that opened into a courtyard this is something I try to avoid but die to price was not aprobl this time

review.title: Exfoliate with the towels they are so bad!
review.reviewText: It was mentioned before we booked that the towels were "thin". I worked as a maid between semesters in college so i knw how room shld be cleaned. The towels were beyound thread bare, they had holes in them and were no longer white. I wldn't use them for rags. The maids left their buckets outside in front of our "view" and since no elevator wld drop the used linens over the railings to the bottom level. The tub antislip stripes were black to grey in the tub. Where a mini refrig was to be was a large space in the dresser. The only thing this motel has done is install flat screen t v. They need to replace all the linens and lower the prices. They might be in the Marina but aren't that level. It was loud and dark and worn out. The furnature, rug etc all seen better days. It was the pits!
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom and towels
review.locationRemarks: Steps steep up to rooms, noise from garage below loud, bad cell service area, dark interior rooms

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: This hotel is a good value for the San Francisco area; not expensive, clean, but not many frills. A good value for anyone who is looking to see San Francisco in a clean room.

review.title: Good value for San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I chose this hotel (really, a motel) for low rates (for San Francisco) and proximity to Fisherman's Wharf. I think the value was very fair for the downtown area. Room had all one needed: bed, bath, plenty of closet and drawer space, TV with (I guess) about 60 channels, coffee maker, iron, two armchairs, etc. All rooms are up one or two flights of stairs, motel style. I asked for and got a room on the lower floor. Continental breakfast, cereal, toast, waffles, coffee/tea, juice, was included. Hotel was quiet, despite what I read in reviews on Net! Lombard Street is busy and noisy, but hotel rooms are in wings running back from street and opening on courtyard, so road noise is not heard in room. No noisy parties either, so had quiet comfortable stay. The building looks older, but the bathroom (bath/shower and john) and sink area (in bedroom) were much newer and in good shape. Owners stored my baggage for me after checkout ( I had an evening departure) and called a cab for me. Bus on Chestnut Street one block away goes very close to Fisherman's Wharf; other buses on Fillmore, 1 1/2 blocks away. About four restaurants within a block; many restaurants and eateries within a few blocks. Convenience store 1/2 block away.

This isn't a Sheraton or Hilton, but it was comfortable and convenient. One quibble: the room was overall clean but the daily cleaning a bit short; carpet not vacuumed every day, but every other day (I think). Overall, good value for money, especially for SF!!!
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to Fisherman's Wharf and downtown; good for vacationers.

review.title: good to be in san fransico
review.reviewText: i would like to stay agin hopfully soon. we love san fransico!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing bad
review.locationRemarks: good area if your a mellow kind of person young and with somone you like to spend time with a bar called voodoo lounge walkin distance

review.title: Dirty hotel
review.reviewText: Very dirty.. Restroom door would not lock and shower was extremely dirty.

review.title: Very disappointing
review.reviewText: I expected more from a Ramada. "Free parking" meant only a few spaces, not enough for all, which meant we felt we had to walk everywhere or lose the space. Had a screaming domestic dispute next to our room in the wee hours of the night that brought the police to our door. After that, we never felt truly safe. Breakfast was a joke--white bread and cold cereal. Very poor housekeeping from day to day. Next time I'll spend an extra $20 a night for something at least average in condition.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything! The hike up the stairs to the second floor with full luggage was an extra treat.
review.locationRemarks: Sketchy. Never felt fully safe.

review.title: Bad experience
review.reviewText: This hotel should not be listed, cleanliness was poor, furniture old, complementary breakfast was ridicolous

review.title: A little disgusted...
review.reviewText: Did not feel safe in this area.Not very clean.Breakfast was not adaquately set up.Not very clean at all.
review.negativeRemarks: dinginess of hotel and room.Also no elevators.
review.locationRemarks: Decent location and free parking a plus!

review.title: Sleepless in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Althought the hotel had clean sheets and the beds were reasonably comfortable, there was a feeling that the hotel was in sore need of updating. The breakfast was woeful to the point that we couldn't really eat it. Did they water down that orange juice?? Thankfully there are a great many good places nearby for breakfast. Most disturbing was the fact that every time someone closed a door it echoed down the hallyway like a prison. Gave us several sleepless nights!! Never again!!
review.negativeRemarks: Slamming doors like a prison!
review.locationRemarks: Location is actually quite good and close to public transport.

review.title: One mile from Pier 39
review.reviewText: The hotel was cheap and only about a mile from pier 39 which was nice. It isn't fancy. The room was clean. The only complaint would be the door was very thin you you could hear outside conversations and noise easily.

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: Ice maker down the hall runs automatically all night so it's disruptive when trying to sleep. Walls are shallow so you can hear your neighbors and, even worse, people in the hallway. The latter is especially bothersome.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to the Presidio, coffee shops, restaurants, drug store.
review.negativeRemarks: Ice maker noise, people noise in the hallway
review.locationRemarks: It's in the heart of the Marina: near the Presidio, Golden Gate Bridge, Fort Mason where the view is spectacular.

review.title: it should not be called "Ramada hotel" !
review.reviewText:
1st,very few parking,have to park outside!
2nd,breakfirst is very bad,even no place for breakfirst,no fruit,no vagetable!t
3rd,no elevator,and u have to take your baggage to climb ladder!
4th,almost no light for every room,coz all the room window face a small well!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: bad location!awful traffic!f***king place

review.title: Good option
review.reviewText: Near the bay, restaurants, chinatown, the parking is dark.

review.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!
review.reviewText:
IT WAS THE WORST HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED IN!
Parking was only first-come, first-served, so we had to park 2 1/2 blocks away. The room was not vacuumed and I stepped on a raisin. The side chair was stained and very dusty. The sheets were stained and so thin you could see through them. The fitted sheet had a hole the size of a quarter. I tried calling the main desk, but no one answered. If it were not 2am (East Coast time) and I was not so exhausted, I would have walked the 2 1/2 blocks to get my car, load everything up again and drive to the nearest hotel. The next morning I reported the issues at the desk, but they only said they would speak to housekeeping.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Noisy. Not at all what I expected being listed in Pacific Heights, San Fransisco.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Great location and great staff. Me and my friend stayed there for three nights, and overall it was a good experience. However, that being said, the hotel needs a lot of maintenance and parking is critical (parking is offered on a first arrival basis); the breakfast is simple and you'll have to take a tray to your room since there is no breakfast room or so. The staff is great, very friendly people.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall appearance
review.locationRemarks: Good location, the hotel is within walking distances to fisherman's wharf, lombard street and golden gate park

review.title: Close to Wharf & good area but don't waste money
review.reviewText: The only 3 positive things this hotel has going is that there is free parking, not alot, but some, in a great area, and they let me check in early. I asked for a non smoking room, but got a smoking which was so smelly I had to sleep with the window open. It was surface clean, but so shabby. My sheets had holes in them and the pillows were so hard they were useless really. Wait 4 positive. Had a great shower head. I didn't want to shower but had to so that was a pleasant surprise. The towels were not. Mine had blue paint stains on them. It was so loud, but that was the guest not the staffs fault. It was close to where I needed to be and I didn't have my kids with me. If I did have them, I would have checked out and called Expedia and complained to high heaven.
review.negativeRemarks: The whole thing. Very shabby and unsure about it really being remotely clean.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to Wharf and nightlife and great resteraunts, but they need a total overhaul to make me every want to stay here again.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText:
We found good restaurants and shops for dinner .the union street shops !
Well located for a night in San Frnacisco.

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: First of all the beds were very noisy and uncomfortable to sleep. the other guests were very noisy. bottom line we could not sleep very well the two nights we spend there.

review.title: MISTAKE!!
review.reviewText: Beds were awful. The noise from the street seemed louder in the room that if you were actually outside, on the street. There were guests vomiting and urinating right outside our room at all hours of the night. The vomit still wasn't cleaned up by the time we left at 9:15 in the morning. Disgusting.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Loud, dirty, cheap breakfast. Waste of money.

review.title: Good Hotel except no elevator.
review.reviewText:
This Hotel was not bad for me, but there was no elevator.
I should carry my heavy travel bag to up staires.
But the hotel room condition was good.

review.title: This is a Ramada? Don't belive it!
review.reviewText:
We had a lousy experience at this hotel. From check-in to check out the service and environment were not worth the money. First, our non-smoking king reservation "wasn't available" so they put us into a smoking double room. All of the rooms face inward and the place is loud -between the loud guests, traffic noise and banging doors it was difficult to get any sleep.
Our door lock broke, the phone didn't work and we had to crawl out the window to get down to the front desk to let them know. That meant another room change where the phone worked but the TV channels were limited to a sports channel and a few local Spanish stations.
We are used to budget motels but this one is BAD. They advertise free parking BUT that is first-come, first-serve and is often not available. Also, there is no elevator and the steps to the 2nd and 3rd floors are not great.
Can't believe this motel is a Ramada.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: According to budget maybe its ok.

review.title: Gorilla style, stay here!
review.reviewText: If you want to do a Gorilla style in SF, stay here! It's creepy but relatively safe. The only good thing about this place is the staff; however, they should clean and take care of the place and they will bring more business in.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the piers and public transportation

review.title: Worst in the Bay
review.reviewText: I travel extensively worldwide for my work and this is probably the worse hotel I have ever stayed at. Aside from homeless people sleeping on the steps of the hotel, the location directly on Lombard Street is the worse. The street noise is extremely loud and it was difficult to sleep. In addition, the noise from the outside corridors to the rooms with the tile floor was also loud. The room is old and looks old, not very clean with dust on the floor molding as well. I thought because it was a âRamadaâ how bad could it be but I learned my lesson. This hotel should be dropped from the Expedia list immediatelyâ¦

review.title: Good value for location and needs
review.reviewText:
We went to SF for Fleet Week events spending two nights at the Ramada Limited. The biggest negative I would say is at the rooms all face inward (could be worse) into the open-to-the-sky, multi-floor courtyard with concrete flooring so as any suitcase on rollers came by or people were talking out there it was noisy. The other negative is the clubby atmosphere on the street on Friday and Sat nights from the places in the block or two around the hotel. Once you get off Lombard its a great area.

The room was small but updated - flat screen tv with cable, granite-tiled sink area and bathroom, fairly modern furniture. Since the hotel was in walking distance to Marina Green, Fort Mason, Ghiradelli Square, Mel's Diner, Chestnut Street shopping area, Palace of Fine Arts and the Exploratorium, we were able to leave our car there for the duration of our stay which saved us quite a bit of time and money.

It's not the most luxurious place, but for the amount of time we spent in our room it worked great.

review.title: DO NOT STAY HERE
review.reviewText: This is a very poor hotel.....located in a residential area so you can't walk anywhere close. Very little parking. Poor bedding and bad mattress covers. Small rooms. Very little to speak of in the way of a continental breakfast...This is NOT the place for anyone to stay. I booked it through an unpublished rate and that's probably the only way they get bookings or just out of desperation.

review.title: Very noisy!
review.reviewText:
The Hotel is in a good neighborhood. You can walk to bars and restaurants.It has very limited parking (18 spots). We were lucky with the parking. Our room was a smoking room (we didn't even think California would have a smoking room because they were one of the first states with no smoking in restaurants.
The mattress had a large cigarette burn in it and the sheets seemed to be clean but were very old and thin (and pink-odd). To get to your room you walked upstairs from the street on to a brick paved walkway to your room. This was more like a motel than a hotel. You can hear a lot of noise from people walking past with luggage and in general. Pop machine was on the 1st level and ice machine was on the second level. Room was very musty smelling.

review.title: Run in the other direction
review.reviewText: One word - "DUMP"

review.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!
review.reviewText: This hotel should not be part of the Ramada Chain! It is probably the worst hotel in the Ramada Chain. Front desk staff was pleasent. That was the best part. The room smelled of urine. The breakfast consisted of a couple of types of cold cerial, the toaster only toasted one side of the bread, the juice was watered down. The waffle maker worked good. During our stay, we had to ask for facecloths daily, (unsure if they were washed as I think my shoe shine rags are cleaner, and one day, the young man at the front desk advised that they did not have facecloths). When I complained to the Ramada Corp, they advised the owner and he emailed us back offering us a 40% reduction on our next stay at his hotel. Fat chance on us ever staying there again! An overall disguisting stay and a huge disapointment!

review.title: Too Noisy - Perfect for guests wanting 2 hours of sleep!
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a sleepless night, look no further. The biggest issue we had during our stay was the lack of sleep due to the continuous noise. Be prepared to hear vehicle noise particularly if your unit is more towards the street which doesnt die down until around 1.00 am and starts up again around 6.00 am. The hotel has an open centre concept allowing for the road noise to go over the building and back in sounding like a hurricane wind. Around 1.00 am to 3.00 am you get to hear yelling drunk people coming back from bars or parties and around 5.00 am you will hear the first guests leaving their rooms. The tiles throughout and the stairs (no elevators) ensure for more noise as peoples suitcases wheels get pulled along the tiles and wripped down the stairs. The ice machine will also get your attention. If you are thirsty there is a huge pop machine but be prepared to like Mountain Dew as it is the only pop that was not out of order. The parking is free, but there are limited spaces available (15) in relation to the number of rooms (40) so be prepared not to get one one if you show up after 8.00 pm. The breakfast is OK, although not as comprehensive as most other Ramadas, but there is no seating area so bring your own tray from home or use their tiny bathroom tray and take your breakfast into your room. Very inconvenient and disappointing! On a more positive note the hotel is relatively inexpensive and is well situated.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Hotel and room was clean. Location was a bit far from transportation.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Not impressed. Towels are dirty and grey colored. Place is small, dark and dirty. Not a standard Ramada at all! Very disappointed.

review.title: One of the cheapest hotels in the area for a reason
review.reviewText: We are rarely in our hotel rooms when we travel because we're so busy sightseeing. SO location while, hotel was great. Walk to Fisherman's whaft (You have to try the clam chowder!) is only about 1.5 miles. Safe area. Parking is 1st come, 1st serve so when we got a spot we would walk around the rest of the day. The breakfast is served in their tiny lobby consisting of waffles and toast. We were not giving bath size towels the 1st night so when we got home late, we had to deal with the hand towels to dry off with. Our 1st 'breakfast' there, an angry hotel resident came in complaining that his toilet overflowed and they refused to comp him for the night. Not the best service...All in all, if you don't stay in the room much you'll be fine.

review.title: San Francisco comfort
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean, it offered continental breakfast at reasonable hours. The location was a bit far from where we thought it would be, but other than that, our stay was very comfortable.

review.title: Stay somewhere else
review.reviewText:
The only positive thing about this hotel is the location. The shower curtain was black with dirt and soap scum. the towels were frayed and stained. I requested fresh towels but they were as dirty. They hang dry their towels and bath mats on the bannisters!
Even when i asked for my room to be cleaned they did not do it. All I was told is "later" with a frown.
Please stay somewhere else if you can. I would never go back there or suggest anyone stay there! Truly disappointed.

review.title: Good Location, But Definitely "Limited"
review.reviewText: This hotel has a very convenient location, within walking distance to food and shopping (Union and Chestnut streets) and some sightseeing (Exploratorium, Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square). Otherwise public transport to other places and airport is convenient as well. Service is very good. But don't expect any luxury. You basically get the bare minimum of amenities.

review.title: Just Alright
review.reviewText: Located on the Very, Very, Very busy Lumbard Street. Our keys kept on de-magnetizing so they kept having to re-scan or give us a new one. Could of just been bad luck though. Good for location, But bad for noise. It is fairly close to Fisherman's Warf, but that is about it. The continental Breakfast is alright for the first day, But the Waffles, One type of toast, and 2 types of cereal, get really boring after that. Staff was very willing to help with directions when asked and lots a brochers in the lobby.

review.title: Great location for the sights of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Do not be fooled by the outward appearance of this motel The rooms are spacious. There are no services outside of tv, internet, vending and continental breakfast. the staff is extremely curtious and will to provide above and beyond services if you ask. I would definately stay there again!

review.title: A pleasant and economical stay
review.reviewText:
We chose this hotel because it was less expensive than most others so we
could then spend our savings on better dining. We also saved with free parking, even though the limited # of spaces are not always vacant. As other reviews
noted, the linen is not new, but it is clean. We enjoyed being close to the GG
Park and Bridge and having convenient access to both the coast & the city.
We also were able to avoid some of the city's legendary parking problems by
finding a number of enjoyable restaurants within several blocks walking distance,
and there are bus stops close by for venturing into the city without worrying about
finding parking places or having a designated driver back to the hotel.
We will be happy to stay there again, if the price remains reasonable.

review.title: Ramada BAD Experience
review.reviewText: This was the worst hotel I have ever experienced. It wasn't even on the par of a cheap motel. The rooms were shabby, the toilet was broken in my girl's room (we had to fix it ourselves, because the night manager had no idea what to do), the blankets were moth-eaten and falling apart, the beds were extremely uncomfortable and there were rowdy, loud drunken people making noise all night long. Oh, and did I mention the couple that had a raging, violent domestic at midnight that scared the heck out of my children. I do not recommend this hotel!

review.title: good value for the price
review.reviewText: claen little place , nothing fancy , good value for the price of the rom. Satff excellent to answer questions and give directions.

review.title: A good hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was simple, very clean, bathroom and sheets really really clean! A good cable tv with a lot of channels. It is an old hotel, the carpet is very old, but it was good, I would come back there. But don't expect find a spot for your car, there are not enough spots and in the streets is difficult to find one either.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: very noisy, most of the staff was rude,the hotel was just dirty,would go to san fran again but would not stay at this hotel again!

review.title: If you want peace and quite this is not the place.
review.reviewText:
Traffic noise is terrible in front of Hotel. Main street to the Golden Gate Bridge.
People were talking very loud and shamming doors most of the night. Parking is very limited. And breakfast does not have much to choose from.

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText: Our room smelled cat wiwi we were really uncomfortable.

review.title: not a good review
review.reviewText: not safe, not nice, not close to Fisherman's wharf

review.title: A lot to be desired.
review.reviewText: This hotel was not clean. Insufficient parking area. Didn't feel like a very safe neighborhood. The only advantage was its locaiton. I would not recommend it to anyone.

review.title: Not very impresseed
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and bed was comfortable. Good TV. However, room was very small. It was on second floor and there was no elevator and no one to help with getting luggage upstairs. Didn't deliver clean towels twice in four days. Didn't deliver soap, shampoo, etc. most days. It was cheap and clean, that is alll I can say for it. I wouldn't stay there again.

review.title: Stay Away...Stay Far Away!
review.reviewText: The room is bare bones which is fine, but it was dirty (cobwebs in corners, dust on everything, moldy smell in the room). I think prisons have better towels and sheets. The walls were paper thin so not only can you hear everything going on in the hotel, but being on busy Lombard street all you heard was traffic and people all night long. We got absolutely no sleep at all. Do not even waste your time on the breakfast bar either. In the morning we thought atleast we can grab a free breaskfast when we left; it looked disguisting. The rate seemed good that is why we picked it, but remember, you get what you pay for. Do not stay here. Do not even recommend to your enemies.

review.title: Very accomidatingh
review.reviewText:
Room ready even thought we were early.
Friendly, well informed, helpp ful staff.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: TV didn't work at all and we kinda felt like it was our fault. Less than helpful staff consistently through our time there.

review.title: We'd go back
review.reviewText: I read many reviews and was ready to commit when my husband stated he had just booked our room. I was a little apprehensive because I know he did not do any leg work, but all turned out well. It was a bit far by foot to most of the places we wanted to see but it was reasonal and worked for us.

review.title: Great and cheap place to stay in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great for that price! We had no major complains. The room was clean, nothing was broken and the staff was nice. The only small disadvantage is that there is no sitting area for breakfast, so you gotta take it back to your room, one person can sit at the desk but the rest has to eat sitting on the bed... but who cares... The location is also really great, you can basically walk to all major sights in 10-45min walks and there are also two bus stops very close by, if one gets tired of walking those hills.

review.title: Nice choice
review.reviewText: Good for the price

review.title: Not a bargain. Won't be back.
review.reviewText: Did not know we would have to climb a flight of stairs. The parking garage is on ground level with Lombard Street and only has about 8 parking spaces, so you need to get there very early and not move your car. Late afternoon, someone vomited almost directly in front of our room, the desk clerk did not want to clean it up, but finally did.

review.title: Very good value, well run budget hotel after staying at J.W. Marriott Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The Ramada Limited Hotel on Lombard Street San Francisco was a very pleasant experience. The hotel was very clean and well looked after. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I loved the "make your own waffle" complimentary breakfast and the coffee was great. I enjoyed the night life on Lombard Street and I felt very safe walking even late at night. I recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and like to take advantage of the public transportation system of San Francisco.

review.title: DONT DO IT!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was the worst experience. There are no do not disturb signs, we decided to sleep in at twice during our 3 day stay the room was opened by housekeeping without my concent. Good thing I was under the covers. Jacuzzi tube did not work and was filthy. Shower curtain had mold and was extremely unconfortable. There was way to much furniture in the room. We had to move furniture to move around the room. I would rather have spent the additional money and stayed at a nicer hotel.

review.title: Cheap and almost cheerful
review.reviewText: No frills, cheap (more like a motel) place to stay in San Fran. Close to Union street, so skip the waffles for breakfast and head there for Crepes. Wireless internet worked fine. NO LIFT and uncomfortable bed.

review.title: Nice place to stay in the Marina
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to Fisherman's Wharf and Union Street. Our room was quiet and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel's garage was full, but on the weekend we had no trouble finding street parking nearby.

The front desk guy was great, helpful with directions, parking and extremely nice. The room was awesome, minus a window with a view. The noise throughout the night was tough to sleep through along with people constantly checking to see if our romm was locked....Not so great. If the employees at this hotel were at another location, I would stay there everytime, as for a revisit,,,,,I think we'll look elsewhere..

review.title: IT WAS BAD...
review.reviewText: I had a problem in the room, instilled of taken care of the problem themself. I was advised to take care of it myself. After a long day of site seeing, I was not in the mood to "Unclog the toliet". Requested extra towels, they never came. complained about noisy neigbors, and nothing was done. Every unhappy!

review.title: bad impression
review.reviewText: the parking lot is too narrow for the , is today type of car we have. there are no elavators, arriving with lugage is not a happy thing. the rooms are to noise, due to there are no door clossing the aisle that conect to the street and Lombard is a very heavy traffic av. the cover sheet are not 100% cotton, resting in polyester makes me loose my dreams.

review.title: Nice but small
review.reviewText: The pictures made the room and breakfast area look much bigger. The breakfast area is a counter in the small check-in area. I couldn't figure out why everyone kept slamming doors until I had to slam mine to get it to close. It's the only way with the lock design. I felt the room was very nice and clean for the price.

review.title: The reception staff were very helpfull.
review.reviewText: The reception staff were very helpfull. I would only recommend this if someone wanted a cheap hotel. I was a little disapointed with the cleanliness.

review.title: Very dirty and noisy
review.reviewText: I payed way too much money here stay for one night and was really horrified at the condition of the room. The bathtub floor was brown with dirt, the shower curtain had mold on it, there was mysterious brown "material" on the wall adjacent to the toilet and the bed looked as if someone had slept in it but none of he bedding was cleaned. The blanket was also ripped. I did not get any sleep due to other people coming in and out of their rooms all night yelling and partying. The way the hotel is layed out, it promotes sound reverberation off the walls so it is very noisy at night. I have stayed in many hotels and motels over the years and I have never written a complaint about any of them. I feel it is worth my time to warn people about this particular place.

review.title: Great location, many shops , clubs & resteraunts to walk to.
review.reviewText: Basic, but decent.

review.title: Good place
review.reviewText: Good location, you dont want to stay downtown its not so nice, you can just jump on a bus and your straight in town.

review.title: good for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel was decent for the price we paid. Barely any parking though. Within a mile of fishermans wharf and pier 39 which is what we wanted. Overall the hotel itself was in decent condition. The beds were not all that comfortable though.

review.title: Should thnik twice before staying on Lombard Street.
review.reviewText: Hotel was old and the sheets and blankets were too! Parking is a problem, there is very little. If you park on the street for more than two hours you will get a ticket. The closest parking structure is a block and a half away. The Hotel has parking for less than half of there rooms. There was no supervison of kids running up and down the halls, steps, and slamming doors at all hours. There is no elevator to assist you in getting your bags to your room.

review.title: A good base and a good price
review.reviewText: We booked this one on the name and reputation. We stayed for two nights and it was in a good position for Fisherman's Wharf. The price was also good. The breakfast was us standing in reception cooking waffles and walking along the pavement and back up to our room..You pays your money..

review.title: not enough parking spaces !!!
review.reviewText: All was not bad (except clogged sink ) but this hotel does not provide parking spaces for all guests !!!

review.title: OK to stay
review.reviewText: Room was small for 5, but liveable. Parking is first come, first serve. Room was clean, plenty of hot water. No elevator and no ground floor rooms.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: No Coffee at time posted, very noisy, no king bed, no phone, hot water takes a very long time.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great place to stay for a traveler on a budget. Its close to bus lines that will take you anywhere in the city. Just 2 blocks up is Union Street, and 2 blocks right is Filmore where shopping, bars, restruants and night life is plenty. Parking was first come first serve, however the front desk will hold your keys should you need to double park over night. I rated Hotel service a 3 because the staff were not to friendly, however they did exactly what they needed to do for me. I also rated Comfort a 3 because the pillows were a bit lumpy, but the bed was really comfortable. Over all I would recommend this to a budget traveller who wants to stay in the marina area. Access to bus lines that will take you right to the Pier area and also shopping and night spots are in walking distance. Hotel lobby is smaller than expedia's picture, however who needs a big lobby. The lobby has a kiosk with lots of available city tours you can do. They evey provide a city map with bus and trolly routes for free!! This helped a lot. The continental breakfast was small and very self serve however it did the job when you just want to eat something small before you head out. One downfall is there is some traffic noise from Lombard Ave where it is a main street. Also some noise from other hotel guests coming up and down the stairs. Being a younger traveller, it all added to an overall cool experience.

review.title: Motel, Decent Price, Decent Service
review.reviewText: I was quite impressed with this motel. It is a 30 to 60 minute walk to Pier39 (depending on how fast you walk). Parking is limited, so we did a lot of walking. Our room was clean and in good condition. The bathroom looked recently remodeled. There were no extra pillows in the room, or an iron, so I had to ask. The bed sheets had a few small tears in them, barely noticeable though. Shower was in good condition and water was hot, water pressure was good too. The room had a good heater/AC unit so we were able to stay quite warm. Noise: If you don't mind street noise, or the echo of other guests, this motel is alright. The two levels of rooms and outside stairwells are in a large courtyard, and the traffic noise from the street echoes too. We slept relatively well. The motel has a secure room to store our luggage while we were checked out. Breakfast: The continental breakfast was alright. Waffles were good. Cereal, Toast too. Staff were friendly enough. Polite, spoke English. If you are looking for cost effective, and a good walk to burn off all that eating, this is the spot!

review.title: Decent Hotel for the price
review.reviewText: not enough parking available at the hotel.

review.title: Don't expect a good night sleep
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel with my family on a Friday and Saturday evening. Both nights I was woken up every hour (between 11pm - 3 am) by drunk teenagers that were either running around the hotel knocking on everyone's door, or yelling out that their keys didn't work, or just talking really loud. Management made an attempt to quiet the loud guests the first time we complained, but then it gave up. The office is further from the noise, so it isn't as noticeable to them. The hotel may be cheap, but it's actually a big price to pay if you're expecting a good night of sleep in San Francisco because you'd just be wasting it.

review.title: Dirty and out of the way
review.reviewText: The room was typical for this type of hotel (Motel is more the word) - The bathroom was not cleaned very well- it smelled like urine. There was no soap or shampoo. For the amount I paid I expected better. I would never go back.

review.title: OK For budget minded
review.reviewText: This hotel has free parking first come. 12 spaces. The bath was OK shower was for short people. TV picture was awful. Remote was broke. Hall lights went out before sunup. But for just a cheep place to stay, it will do.

review.title: low budget, not the worst
review.reviewText: The Good: free parking, excellent location, descent bathroom and fair bed. The Bad: staff is does not communicate in english well. Front Desk man could not tell me which way to go on Lombard coming up Van Ness from the water, right or left? He was at a total loss.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: For a motel 1/2 the price of others on Lombard street you could not knock what you get for your dollar. It is an ideal motel for a cheap trip to San Francisco. Staff were polite and the neighborhood was safe.

review.title: Cheap Hotel Rate for Area
review.reviewText: Lots of places to eat and drink within walking distance

review.title: Not even a half star quality
review.reviewText: Receptionist was rude with his TV up so loud we had to yell to communicate.

review.title: Not impressed at all!!!
review.reviewText: They didn't have my reservation on file. Then they said they had no rooms. Then they gave us a key to a room in which someone was already staying. Finally we got a room. Not the nicest hotel I've stayed in, and I have recently stayed in quite a few. For the price... quite disappointing.

review.title: Noisy and No elevators
review.reviewText: The room we had had a broken toilet seat and the toilet leaked (which I fixed) smoking rooms are below so the smoke rises to the non smoking rooms. Had to keep asking for extra towels to accomodate the # of people in the room and the noise from other guest rooms carry and echo due to room layout.

review.title: Just Ok for the $
review.reviewText: Wireless internet was nice everything worked, it was the least expensive room in the area so I got it. Next time I will spend the extra on a nicer establishment. Walls are thin not enough parking for all the guest which is another reason to stay in a more expensive establishment. Free parking is hard to find I had to park in a parking structure 18$ read signs carefully. O ya don't eat the breakfast I used the Restroom in the main office and I saw the wisk, pitcher, and other breakfast stuff...

review.title: Friendly Service
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They gave me tips when I first arrived on how to enjoy the sights and would answer any questions I had. The walk to fisherman's pier was longer than I thought. Parking in the hotel is very limited so if you come back at night, there usually aren't any spaces available. Overall, it was a nice hotel and I would go there again. The continental breakfast even had waffles you make fresh yourself.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Like the area we stayed in, close to alot of good eating establishments (Lucca Deli is great!) and shops, but would look for another hotel in same location. While the front desk staff was very helpful with how to get around, and things to go see the cleaning service was inadequate, and the hotel was on the noisy side.

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText: Advertises "free parking". Has 12 spaces for 37 rooms. NO elevator, no rooms on first floor. NO screen on only window - pigeons wanted in. Did not honor "no smoking" request. Place stunk. Hole in bathroom door. Only place with enough light to read a map was the bathroom. Broken cabinet, cracked mirror glass. Burn holes in bedding. No sympathy from staff.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Hotel was very noisy with a metal staircase going up the middle of the hotel. It was also a bit too over priced, however the room was clean comfortable and close to a bus stop that dropped off at all the main places. Would stay there again if the price was lower.

review.title: Would not stay again
review.reviewText: The beds and pillows are very hard, and we were very uncomfortable sleeping. The walls are so thin you can hear people talking in their rooms and coming up the loud metal staircase. You can also hear the city noise come in from the streets, and on top of that there is no elevator! It was not a pleasant stay.

review.title: If you're going to San Francisco...
review.reviewText: Even if there is some noise from the street and the breakfast is poor, this place is nice, well situated, a couple of blocks to Marina & Pier 39. Rooms are clean, but beds are slightly tight. If you would like a clean place to sleep, not too expensive, and if you're not afraid of street's noise, this will be perfect for a couple of days.

review.title: Not at Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: The Hotel is nice. the breakfast is small: Waffles, coffee, milk, white bread and juice! it's ok. The Hotel is about 20min (with the bus) away from Fisherman's wharf!! The people at the front desk try to keep their guests satisfied but their are just tring.

review.title: Good Hotel for Pricey San Francisco
review.reviewText: People at front desk were courteous and helpful. Continental breakfast was satifying, included a waffle maker. Hotel was pricey, but not going to find anything much cheaper in San Fran.

review.title: Never go back
review.reviewText: Hotel is noisy, dirty, and uncomfortable

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel is built in a courtyard style and on a busy street. You can hear all the street noise, plus when someone comes in late night or early morning you can hear them talking and walking up the metal staircase. We were in the middle of the courtyard, so imagine it must have been far worse up toward the street, but better toward the back. Parking was ideal, price was right and I loved the location next to Union and Chestnut street, but won't stay there again.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Lot of good eateries in walking distance, maybe 4 blocks to waterfront where you can see the Golden Gate. There is also a Safeway grocery there if you want to buy some non-restaurant food to take along or have a picnic. There is also a kid's playground about a block north (and a gym at the rec center as well as some softball fields). If you don't get a spot in the lot you can park around there at night but wake up early if it is a weekday, there are timed zones and street cleaning days to be aware of. We had read some of the reviews about the sound being loud so we weren't bothered...on Christmas Day when there was little traffic. There is a single stairway that goes upstairs into the courtyards and the street sounds from Van Ness Ave. (US Hwy 101) goes up and echoes; a bit of sound deadening or a door and 50% would probably be gone. Tile walkways may be durable but guests rolling their suitcases made an echoing click-click you could hear.

review.title: Quite a bit of street noise.
review.reviewText: Quite a bit of street noise, but the bed was comfortable and the price was right.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Good and friendly service

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel was noisy from other guests. Towells were thin and torn. One was not only thin and torn there was a whole corner missing.

review.title: Good for the Price
review.reviewText: For a budget motel in the Marina District, we were quite satisfied across the board.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: It just didn't feel clean and I was not impressed with the room.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: cleaning of room is not carefully controlled and outside loud voice bother to sleep.

review.title: It was ok
review.reviewText: The walls really are paper thin, you can hear the noise of the street constantly. But, that was really the only bad part. The walk to Fisherman's Wharf was an easy one, no big hills. Their complimentary breakfast was very good. We loved the make-them-yourself waffles!!

review.title: Hotel is fine for the money
review.reviewText: Location is good. Hotel is fine especially for the money Very clean

review.title: it was a bit noisy; but the location was fantastic, and the room very nice
review.reviewText: great

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: This hotel was not all that nice. It had some nice components to it, but mixed in with all of the older parts of the room it didn't make it very nice. The continental breakfast was also disappointing. They had juice, but every morning(like just an hour or so after it had started) they were out of juice. That left you with one kind of cereal and a waffle.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: for the price of the hotel, you can walk down the street for a better deal and a better stay. it's not a bad place, but you can get more for your money elsewhere around the same nieghbrhood.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Very noisy from the street. Holes in the shower wall, plasterboard above showerhead coming off. Pillows like rocks. I was checked out by a 12 year old kid who told me I had to wait because "the others were busy", despite the fact the room was paid for in full inadvance. I was there by myself, would never take, or recommen, to others.

review.title: Not Too Bad
review.reviewText: This hotel offers the bare minimum. However, it is in a great location, within walking distance of most major attractions. The rooms were clean and the staff was accommodating.

review.title: Very upset!
review.reviewText: I don't like to complain, but I would never stay in this hotel again and I would never recommend it to any of my friends! Imagine: blankets, sheets and pillowcases with holes, lamps without covers and lightbulbs, torn towels, paper walls. Very disturbing experience... And definately not so close to Fisherman Wharf.

review.title: I would use hotel again
review.reviewText: Good location, for what I needed.

review.title: Served it's purpose
review.reviewText: Heading to Napa but got a late flight into San Francisco. So decided to stay at this hotel because I have stayed here before for business. Just as run down as before but clean (except for a piece of plastic stuck under the covers I had to toss) and very close to the Golden Gate Bridge which for me is a fast getaway in the morning especially with rush hour. One positive to note: free wi-fi in the room. One negative note: Loud. Although rooms are in a courtyard, you can hear cars and people walking around even at 2am.

review.title: A good, basic hotel
review.reviewText: This is an older building, not real fancy, with a parking garage on the ground floor. There are no elevators, it is not set up for any one with problems climbing stairs. For our group, it was just what we were looking for, a clean, safe, centralized place to sleep while we ran around San Francisco. It was also very inexpensive. The staff was very helpful and freindly, making the stay very enjoyable. The money we saved on the hotel we spent on shopping and dining.
