We have all agreed to come back to the Ramada-Fisherman's Wharf on our next run-away to SF.

review.title: good cheap hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was great for the price! The rooms were extremely small but well-kept, and the free parking was a plus. We are definitely going to stay here on our next trip!

review.title: Not bad for the price
review.reviewText: It's not fancy, but it's inexpensive and clean, and they provide limited free parking (which is difficult to find in the area.)

review.title: Not Bad
review.reviewText: This is a good hotel if you are on a budget. It is close to Fishermans Wharf. If the weather is a bad, however, the hotel isn't within a comfortable walking distance. Take a cab then. The hotel is within close to Van Ness street which provides access to the the freeway (and the airport). If you can afford more then stay closer to the Wharf. If you can't, then this isn't a bad place either.

review.title: Okay place to stay
review.reviewText: The front desk personnel were great, and the room was clean.  However, the bed was a board and the outside noise, by other guests, woke me up in the middle of the night and very early the next morning.  I would stay here again if I had to.

review.title: Do not stay here
review.reviewText: This is the worst place I have ever stayed.  The walls are paper thin and people were partying and yelling and stomping up the stairs all night.  The room smelled of urine and there were cigarette burns all over the blanket in our nonsmoking room.  My husband and I got barely any sleep at all because of the noise.  This place is TERRIBLE!!!!!

review.title: Decent, but you need to know:
review.reviewText:
First off, this place is in the Marina District, not Fisherman's Wharf as advertised. If your plans include a visit to Fisherman's Wharf, it is several blocks away up and down a few hills.

The room was clean, the staff was courteous, and it even has wireless Internet! (Unfortunately I found that out AFTER the fact and forgot to bring my wireless network card) The room wasn't terribly big - about the size of a Motel 6 room - but it was more than adequate. For what I got I thought it was a bit pricey, but then again it is right in San Francisco (decent neighborhood too) and not a $40 cab ride away from most attractions. If you do drive there, you either have to park on the street or get one of their small "first come, first serve" spaces (about ten total), and the nearest public transportation is two streets south (again, up and down hills) so be prepared.

review.title: Very small
review.reviewText: Its a very small hotel. Not close to bart stations... but its in a good area and it's clean. Parking is first come first served which is some times bad. Overall its good for the price.

review.title: Not bad for a short stay
review.reviewText: The price was OK, the room was clean, but not a place for a claustrophobe...Most rooms faced an inside atrium with no other window to the outside world. Managed to switch to one of only three rooms facing on Lombard St with an outside window - tiny room with giant handicap bathroom (on the third floor with no elevator) but worth the price. Office people were nice...

review.title: Not at all impressed
review.reviewText: Very small room, very bad maintenance of general hotel as well as room. Torn Comforters due to cigarettes in a non-smoking room.

review.title: A little too noisy
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to the Wharf right on Lombard which was great. Close to restaurants too. However, the parking garage underneath where only 18 cars fit allows voices and any noise to travel up to the rooms. We also had to find parking on the street 4 blocks away since the garage is park free on a first come first serve basis.

review.title: Really convenient Hotel
review.reviewText:
Stayed at this Hotel with my wife and I can say the price was ok, clean room and it's location is really convenient. One block from the Hotel there is a bus terminal (Route 30) that will take you really close to Fisherman's Wharf, Union square and to the Palace of Fine Arts.

I will definitively stay there again.

review.title: It was okay
review.reviewText: It is at the very outskirt of Fisherman's Warf. Far from any tourist sights. The room was nice but the employees werent very helpful. It's okay if u dont mind taking a lot of public transportation.

review.title: My Stay in Ramada Ltd.
review.reviewText: If you are looking for an affordable place to stay that is clean and safe, Ramada Ltd is for you. It's no five star, but it its adequate. Especially for fast going business folks. The free WIFI is also a blast!

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The Ramada Limited was a great place to stay if you're on a budget.  The rooms were newly renovated with newer bathroom appliances and new furniture.  We were very close to everything we wanted to see in SanFrancisco and the staff was very helpful in telling us how to get to everything.
